title: Senior System Engineer (Dell VxRail)
company_info: ASIAPAC TECHNOLOGY PTE LTD AsiaPac is a Singapore ISO9001:2008 and BizSafe Level 3 certified company established since 1990. We have a cohesive, dynamic and relatively young work force of over 80 employees ranging from fresh graduates to industry veterans. Our business is in helping organizations to protect their business, increase productivity and reduce wastage using I.T. Our clienteles which include the public sectors, educational institutions as well as those corporations in the FSI, F&B, manufacturing, healthcare, marine, oil & gas industries, are serviced and supported by our multiple teams of proactive sales and certified support personnel. We are direct partners of industry leaders such as Microsoft, IBM, Oracle, VMware, Cisco, Fujitsu, HP, Fortinet, Hitachi Data Systems, Symantec and Acronis. The core of our business is the fundamental philosophy of ‘All-Win’ where all our customers, suppliers, and employees must collectively win.

Responsibilities:
Provide pre-sales engineering and support
Prepare technical sales support materials
Project Planning: Collaborate with clients, stakeholders, and internal teams to understand the project requirements, objectives, and scope. Develop detailed project plans, including system design, equipment selection, installation methodology, and timelines.
Installation Oversight: Supervise the installation and commissioning of CCTV systems. Ensure that installation practices adhere to industry standards, safety regulations, and best practices.
Testing and Troubleshooting: Conduct system testing to verify functionality and performance. Troubleshoot technical issues and work with the installation team to resolve any problems that arise during the implementation phase.
Client Communication: Act as the primary point of contact for clients during the project, providing regular updates on progress, addressing concerns, and managing expectations.
Design, deploy, and manage physical security systems, including access control and video surveillance solutions.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and provide technical expertise in designing and implementing physical security solutions.
Configure and integrate security systems, such as Lenel OnGuard access control system and Milestone VMS, to meet project requirements.
Stay updated with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in physical security systems, access control, and video surveillance.
Collaborate with vendors and suppliers to evaluate and select appropriate hardware and software solutions.
Prepare and maintain system documentation, including system configurations, diagrams, and procedures.
Conduct training sessions for end-users on the operation and maintenance of physical security systems.
Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
Minimum of 3 years of experience in designing, implementing, and maintaining physical security systems.
Installation and configuration experience with CCTV cameras, NVRs/DVRs, switches, and related equipment.
Integration of CCTV systems with access control or alarm systems to provide comprehensive security solutions.
Proficiency in configuring video management software (VMS) and network settings for seamless camera monitoring, recording, and retrieval.
Understanding of TCP/IP, network structure, firewalls, LAN, and VLAN.
Familiarity with other physical security technologies, such as intrusion detection systems and intercom systems, is a plus.
Proficient in system administration, configuration, and troubleshooting.
Knowledge of industry standards and best practices related to physical security systems, access control, and video surveillance.
Experience such as Lenel OnGuard access control system, Milestone VMS, and other Video Management Systems (VMS) is a big plus

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Role - Systems Administrator (Windows and Azure)

Role Objectives:
• Maintain essential IT operations, including server and client operating systems, security tools, applications, servers, email systems, laptops, desktops, software, and hardware
• Handle business-critical IT tasks and systems that provide commercial advantage in a global marketplace
• Enable faster and smarter business processes and implement analytics for meaningful insights
• Protect business interests by implementing and managing IT Security solutions.
• Nurture dependable IT infrastructure and networking that’s always up and running.
• Partner with internal and external partners to communicate project status, activities, and achievements.

Daily and Monthly Responsibilities:
• Perform server administration tasks (for on-premise and cloud infrastructure), including user/group administration, security permissions, group policies, print services, research event log warnings and errors, and resource monitoring, ensuring system architecture components work together seamlessly.
• Monitor servers and application health using pre-existing management tools and respond to hardware issues as they arise; help build, test, and maintain new servers as needed.
• Maintain internal infrastructure requirements including, laptop and desktop computers, servers, routers, switches, firewalls, printers, phones, security updates; support internet, intranet, LANs, WANs, and network segments.
• Interact with the help desk and other teams to assist in troubleshooting, identify root cause, and provide technical support when needed.
• Perform routine/scheduled audits of the systems, including all backups.

Skills and Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s degree or recognized Diploma in technology or computer science.
• Candidates with Microsoft Certifications preferred.
• Proven work experience in IT - primarily Microsoft platform (on-premise and cloud)
• In-depth knowledge of Windows Servers, Operating systems, current equipment and technologies, Office 365 Administration, system performance-monitoring tools, managing active directories, virtualization (Hyper-V), HTTP traffic, content delivery, and caching
• Experience in managing cloud infrastructure on Azure, migrating servers and active directory to Azure.
• Expertise in creating, packaging, and deploying virtual servers and client devices.
• Knowledge of managing SAN, DAS, and NAS storage solutions.
• Experience in optimizing networking and connectivity devices and solutions.

Work Experience:

5+ Years relevant experience

description:
Roles & Responsibilities

We are helping our client, a leading MNC to look for a proactive & experienced IT professional to join their IT Department. The successful candidate will work with the Network, Security and Software Development team members to ensure that system hardware, operating systems, software systems, and related procedures comply with internal and external standards and security requirements.

Responsibilities
Perform day-to-day operational functions in support of the Microsoft 365 environment. Serve as a Microsoft 365 administrator and subject matter expert (SME), managing and maintaining the M365 infrastructure, applications, and related technologies.
Perform system administration duties in Hybrid cloud environment; Hyper-V/VMware virtualization, Microsoft Windows server, Microsoft Azure Cloud and Microsoft SQL.
Monitor and ensure optimal system performance for potential bottlenecks, identify possible solutions, and ensure system’s availability and reliability in Production environment.
Perform system patching and ensuring that systems are safe and secure against cybersecurity threats.
Perform data management and backup duties for both on-premise and cloud systems and applications.
Assist with Vulnerability Assessment & Penetration Test (VAPT) and IT audit exercise with security team members and external vendors.
Involve in the planning and execution of annual IT DR drills.
Provide escalation support per request from various sources; investigate and troubleshoot issues.
Participate in on-call escalation rotations for 24x7x365 support. Evening, overnight, weekend, holiday, and on-call work may be required.

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology or equivalent.
Microsoft 365 Administrator (MS-10x) certification is preferred.
Microsoft Azure Administrator (AZ-104) certification is a plus.
Microsoft Certified Windows Server Hybrid Administrator Associate (AZ-80x) is an advantage.
5+ years of relevant experience as a System Engineer.
Mid to senior level exposure with Azure, Active Directory, Intune, Teams, OneDrive, SharePoint, Exchange online and other Microsoft 365 product suites.
Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Windows Server, Hyper-V virtualization and databases.
Solid understanding of cybersecurity principles including conditional access and cloud application security.
Familiar with backup tools like Commvault, Azure Backup.
Proficient in Microsoft Visio and documentation.
Proficiency in PowerShell, Azure CLI, and other scripting languages.
Basic knowledge of networking & security concepts.

Others

UK MNC, good corporate culture and 5-day work week (centralized location).
With AWS and variable bonus.

We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

title: Salesforce Administrator
company_info: Preqin is the leading source of data and intelligence for the alternative assets industry, and has numerous leading products and services covering private equity, hedge funds, private real estate and infrastructure. Preqin’s clients include fund managers, investment banks, legal firms, institutional investors, financial advisors, asset managers and placement agents. Preqin is also a prominent supplier of bespoke data and analysis to both industry and mainstream press, regularly appearing in publications such as the Financial Times and Wall Street Journal. Preqin maintains numerous online databases, produces high level financial publications and reports, and undertakes consultancy projects for clients. Preqin is a rapidly growing, privately owned firm headquartered in the City of London with additional offices in New York, San Francisco, Singapore, Hong Kong and Manila.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About Preqin
You will be joining the world’s leading data and insights provider for the alternative assets market. We empower the global financial community with critical information and leading analytics solutions to help them make faster and smarter investment decisions, and to make them with confidence. A forward-thinking company, we lead our industry through innovation. We trust in the power of data, and we use it to increase transparency in alternatives. We believe that access to information leads to more investment in the ideas and infrastructure that build strong communities.

Job overview
As a Salesforce Administrator, you will be part of a team that is the first point of contact for our 500+ Salesforce users spread across the globe. Your work will vary from day to day, covering activities such as user training, issue resolution, building reports, user administration and data clean-up. Where appropriate you will escalate to either a business operations or technical development team.

In this role you will:
Management of support queue, including reporting on progress
Provide best practice guidance and training to users
Resolution or escalation of support issues as appropriate
Building of reports
User administration
Performing of ad hoc data loads
Integration and Third-party apps maintenance
You are a good fit if:
You have at least 3 years of experience as a Salesforce System Administrator
Are Salesforce Administrator certified
Must demonstrate outstanding verbal and written communication skills, communicate effectively with the customers and at all levels of the organization
Experience managing stakeholders and their expectations
Exposure working and Understanding of Salesforce Objects, Roles, Fields, Customisations, Validation rules, Data loader, Workflow rules, Process Builder, Flows, Sandbox Lifecycle, Deployments, change sets, Managed Packages, data management, data loader, Salesforce Apps, Salesforce for Outlook
Knowledge of building/fix reports and dashboards
Working exposure across Sales core cloud products (Sales and Service) and exposure to Pardot and CPQ will be added advantage
Knowledge of Salesforce DevOps will be an advantage but not essential
Analytical thinker with the ability to respond to issues and solve problems
Self-managing and self-organised, with the ability to prioritise appropriately
High-energy, self-motivated and goal-oriented
Company benefits:
Competitive remuneration package
21 days holiday
We also sponsor employees to undertake professional training or to gain qualifications relevant to their career
Our culture and values:

At Preqin, we’re aligned around common values – our shared beliefs that shape Preqin’s corporate culture:

Be customer-obsessed
We exist for our customers. We listen to them and understand their challenges. We design best-in-class data solutions for their success.

Act with integrity
We build trust through honesty and transparency. We’re committed to doing the right thing for our customers, our company, and each other.

Own your success
We’re a high-performance team. We challenge and champion each other in our pursuit of excellence. We never stop learning and strive to become experts in our fields.

Think forward
We lead the industry through innovation. We foster collaboration and creativity to solve our clients’ next challenge and give them a competitive advantage.

Make an impact
We drive positive change as individuals, and as a company. We’re passionate about creating a better tomorrow for our industry and our communities.

Equal opportunities:
Preqin is an equal opportunity employer, with diversity at the heart of our business. It is the policy of Preqin to ensure equal employment and consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, pregnancy, veteran status, genetic information, socioeconomic status, political affiliation, or any other basis prohibited by applicable law. Preqin is committed to offering an inclusive and accessible experience for all job seekers, so everyone has the opportunity to be successful. If you need a reasonable accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please let the Preqin recruiter know at the start of the application process. Reasonable accommodations are modifications or adjustments to the application or hiring process that would enable you to fully participate in that process.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
System Engineer
Working Day: Mon to Fri
Working Hours: 9:30am - 6:30pm
Location: North Bridge Rd
Salary: $4500 - $6000
Responsibilities:
Provide pre-sales engineering and support
Prepare technical sales support materials
Project Planning: Collaborate with clients, stakeholders, and internal teams to understand the project requirements, objectives, and scope. Develop detailed project plans, including system design, equipment selection, installation methodology, and timelines.
Installation Oversight: Supervise the installation and commissioning of CCTV systems. Ensure that installation practices adhere to industry standards, safety regulations, and best practices.
Testing and Troubleshooting: Conduct system testing to verify functionality and performance. Troubleshoot technical issues and work with the installation team to resolve any problems that arise during the implementation phase.
Client Communication: Act as the primary point of contact for clients during the project, providing regular updates on progress, addressing concerns, and managing expectations.
Design, deploy, and manage physical security systems, including access control and video surveillance solutions.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and provide technical expertise in designing and implementing physical security solutions.
Configure and integrate security systems, such as Lenel OnGuard access control system and Milestone VMS, to meet project requirements.
Stay updated with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in physical security systems, access control, and video surveillance.
Collaborate with vendors and suppliers to evaluate and select appropriate hardware and software solutions.
Prepare and maintain system documentation, including system configurations, diagrams, and procedures.
Conduct training sessions for end-users on the operation and maintenance of physical security systems.
Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
Minimum of 3 years of experience in designing, implementing, and maintaining physical security systems.
Installation and configuration experience with CCTV cameras, NVRs/DVRs, switches, and related equipment.
Integration of CCTV systems with access control or alarm systems to provide comprehensive security solutions.
Proficiency in configuring video management software (VMS) and network settings for seamless camera monitoring, recording, and retrieval.
Understanding of TCP/IP, network structure, firewalls, LAN, and VLAN.
Familiarity with other physical security technologies, such as intrusion detection systems and intercom systems, is a plus.
Proficient in system administration, configuration, and troubleshooting.
Knowledge of industry standards and best practices related to physical security systems, access control, and video surveillance.
Experience such as Lenel OnGuard access control system, Milestone VMS, and other Video Management Systems (VMS) is a big plus

title: Senior Specialist, MES System
company_info: WSAudiology is formed in 2019, through the merger of Sivantos and Widex, WS Audiology combines over 140 years of experience in pioneering the use of technology to help people with hearing loss hear the sounds that make life wonderful. We are active in over 125 markets and employ 11,000 people worldwide. Our broad portfolio of hearing-related products and services generates annual revenues of around EUR 2 billion. As advanced as hearing care is today, we are dedicated to making it even better. Our people have a passion for innovation and are committed to applying it to help make a wonderful sound part of everyone’s life. There is nothing more rewarding to us than seeing someone regain the miracle of hearing and watching them thrive. As a leader in our industry, we have already helped improve the lives of millions of people, but there is more to be done. WSAudiology Singapore employs more than 1,300 people across a variety of functions. Here, we host numerous global functions such as Manufacturing & Supply Chain, Quality, IT, Legal, and HR. We also develop and manufacture state-of-the-art behind-the-ear hearing aid devices for our global markets. Learn about us on www.wsa.com
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Join us and be part of our Global IT MES team as a Senior System Analyst and be will be responsible for the operation of Manufacturing Execution System (MES), namely Camstar, 3 Shape and other related applications (including UniQC and BuyDesign) deployed and used globally.
You will specifically be expected to:
MES Application support and Problem Analysis:
Perform new release rollout and system administration on Application Server
Ensuring system and data is available for daily processing of work orders
Daily task include the incident ticket, system failure, optimizing application performance
Perform root cause analysis for major issue
Manage the application support including working with External Service Providers and System Integrators to resolve application issues
Provide support to other integration tools (ERP, Modelling Tools, Test System applications).
Process Improvement and Management:
Analyze the business process and provide possible IT solution that could optimize and improve the process, the scope include SCM process
Develop and translate business needs into technical specifications
Lead and assist teammates in technical or functional roles
Coordinate and lead new MES application related testing & test design for the manufacturing team.
Project:
Provide support throughout project lifecycle (Initiation, Planning, Execution, Delivery, Support) for the identified project and system rollout
Review operation environment periodically to ensure that the operation is effective and sustainable
Managed cross functional teams across multiple sites
Create and implement short- and long-term IT vision for manufacturing team
Maintains database and provides quality assessment to ensure data accuracy and consistency.
Experience:
Degree in Computer Engineering or any other related certifications
Minimum 5 years of proven expertise working on manufacturing systems
Strong in software design, SDLC methodology, MES solution architectures and implementation
Extensive manufacturing experience and working knowledge of plant operations, production controls systems, MES and ERP applications.
Development experience with Camstar MES will be required.
Demonstrated ability to undertake projects and build up internal competency through training.
Who we are
At WS Audiology, we provide innovative hearing aids and hearing health services.
Together with our 12,000 colleagues in 130 countries, we invite you to help unlock human potential by bringing back hearing for millions of people around the world.
With us, you will become part of a truly global company where we care for one another, welcome diversity and celebrate our successes.
Sounds wonderful? We can't wait to hear from you.
WS Audiology is an equal-opportunity employer and committed to creating an inclusive employee experience for all. Regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, disability, military or veteran status we firmly believe that our work is at its best when everyone feels free to be their most authentic self.

title: Applications / systems programmer- z / OS Administrator
company_info: No information added.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Overview:
The z/OS Administrator is responsible for the management, maintenance, upgrades and optimization of z/OS mainframe systems in an organization. This role involves implementing best practices, ensuring system security, performing upgrades, monitoring system health, and addressing technical issues to ensure the continuous and reliable operation of mainframe infrastructure.

Responsibilities:

Installation and Configuration:

Install, configure, maintain and upgrade z/OS operating system and related software.
Set up and manage hardware components, including storage devices, processors, and networking.
Configure system parameters and resources to optimize performance.
System Monitoring and Performance Tuning:

Monitor system performance, resource utilization, and capacity planning.
Analyze performance metrics and make adjustments to improve efficiency.
Implement performance tuning techniques to enhance system responsiveness.
Security and Compliance:

Implement security measures to safeguard mainframe systems and data.
Manage user access controls, authentication, and authorization.
Ensure compliance with industry regulations and organizational security policies.
Backup and Recovery:

Develop and maintain backup and recovery strategies for mainframe data.
Perform routine backups and validate restoration processes.
Plan and execute disaster recovery tests to ensure data integrity.
Troubleshooting and Problem Resolution:

Identify and resolve technical issues and system failures promptly.
Investigate and diagnose hardware and software problems.
Collaborate with other teams to troubleshoot and resolve cross-functional issues.
Patch Management and Upgrades:

Apply software RSU maintenance to keep the system up-to-date.
Plan and execute system upgrades and migrations.
Test compatibility of new software versions with existing infrastructure.
Documentation and Reporting:

Maintain detailed documentation of system configurations, procedures, and policies.
Generate reports on system performance, incidents, and maintenance activities.
Automation and Scripting:

Develop and maintain automation scripts for routine tasks and processes.
Streamline administrative tasks using scripting languages and automation tools.
Collaboration and Communication:

Collaborate with other IT teams, developers, and stakeholders to support application deployment and integration.
Communicate effectively to convey technical information and updates to relevant parties.
Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field (or equivalent experience).
Strong knowledge of z/OS operating system and mainframe architecture.
Proficiency in programming/scripting languages used in mainframe environments.
Familiarity with system monitoring and performance analysis tools.
Experience in security protocols and practices for mainframe systems.
Problem-solving skills and the ability to diagnose and resolve complex technical issues.
Excellent communication and teamwork skills.
Note: Job descriptions may vary depending on the organization's specific needs and the complexity of their mainframe environment. The above description provides a general overview of the responsibilities and qualifications typically associated with a z/OS Administrator role.

Skills:

Must have:
Working knowledge of SMP/E, SYSPLEX, IODF/HCD, WLM, JES2, TSO, ISPF, and SDSF.
Storage Management (DFSMS, DFHSM, DFDSS, VSAM, IDCAMS, ICF Catalogs)

title: SAP Basis Administrator
company_info: ENCORA TECHNOLOGIES PTE. LTD.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Roles and Responsibility:
Responsible for SAP incoming tickets and solve client requests.
The scope of this job specialty includes preparation for new or updated SAP services, management of the change process, management of performance of SAP systems and services.
Individuals in this specialty apply their SAP technical skills to support the operation and maintenance of SAP products and solutions and typically have responsibility for sizing, troubleshooting, and critical client situations.
Required Professional and Technical Expertise :
Apply SAP Basis Knowledge - Apply knowledge of SAP Basis, including the ability to: Understand the key concepts of SAP Basis for current version of SAP Understand the key business and technical drivers of response time and service levels for end users as they relate to SAP Basis Understand how SAP Basis implements across multiple hardware and software platforms Use prescribed IBM Intellectual Capital Network Use prescribed SAP Basis work products with the deployment model/engagement template
Develop Operations Functions & Recovery Procedures - Define and document all operation functions and all requirements for the recovery of any component. Maintain the documentation and regularly validate recoverability.
Implement SAP Basis Environments - Install and administer SAP R3, BW, APO, SEM, SCM, SRM, BI, XI, Netweaver, solution Manager, ECC and other SAP environments. Install SAP code packages. Install SAP middleware and bolt-ons. Set up CCMS monitoring. Apply patches and perform upgrades as needed
Lead Systems Management Function Improvement - Grow and improve the management functions established in support of the client's business as it reacts to changes in business or technology.
Manage SAP Basis Environments [124140] - Lead SAP Basis teams, Maintain SAP metrics strategy. Design and implement SAP systems. Interface with clients to gather system requirements. Interface with SAP on advanced problems through OSS, Perform SAP Healthchecks
Perform Plan, Implement & Custmz Sys Mgmt - Plan, implement and customize systems management functions in a client IT organization.
Perform Systems Administration for SAP Basis - Install and administer SAP R3, BW, APO, SEM, SCM, SRM, BI, XI, Netweaver, solution Manager, ECC and other SAP environments
Perform Systems Management Specialist-SAP - Perform Systems Management Specialist-SAP
Use Systems Management Method or Best Practices - Use a method such as ITIL, ITPM, BSP or any other system of best practices or mixture thereof, to support and configure the systems management functions.
Use Systems Management Tools - Use system management tools such as those from CA, HP and IBM, to support the systems management functions. Implement and configure tools for operational control, growth, planning, resiliency, and recoverability. Systems management functions are: Configuration Management, Change Management, Release Management, Incident Management, Problem Management, Availability Management, Asset Management, Service Continuity, Capacity Management, Service Level Management, and Security Management.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
A glimpse of what you’ll do:
Execute Systems Administration Service Levels
Monitor systems performance and usage, including response times
Supervise backups, optimization, initiation of recovery procedures and routine troubleshooting
Communicate regularly with technical, applications and operational staff to ensure systems integrity and security
Determine the systems’ short- and long-term requirements
Manage systems report production
Advise on System Capabilities
Advise senior leaders on system concepts and functional capabilities
Provide technical advice to the team and clients on installation, setup, configuration of systems
Interpret internal or external business issues and recommends solutions/best practices
Implement plans to make systems available to users in a shared, secure and controlled manner
Develop New Systems
Lead the development of new systems as per the system requirements
Design security and integrity controls
Conduct new systems testing and implementation
Define the system maintenance procedures
Analyze the use of new systems to identify enhancement needs
research initiatives for the development of advanced and automated approaches for system administration
Optimize systems performance
Seek opportunities to optimize the delivery of systems services with emphasis on availability, reliability, scalability, and security
Conduct regular system audits and upgrades
Develop automated processes to define, measure, and report on service quality, stability and capacity
Resolve issues
Oversee the assessment of risks to systems
Identify complex system issues to provide advisory to the stakeholders
Investigate cause of systems issues
Resolve complex issues
Provide escalation support for issues presented by the user
What you’ll need:
Degree/Diploma in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent fields

Working experience in Wintel, AD and VMWare

title: SYSTEMS ADMINISTRATOR
company_info: Dulwich College (Singapore) is the newest addition to the Dulwich College International family of schools in Asia. The College opened its doors to its first students in August 2014. The College caters for a diverse range of international students reflective of Singapore’s cosmopolitan nature as one of Asia’s most vibrant centres. The College will eventually have the capacity for 2,500 students who will enjoy facilities and resources the envy of any school in the world. The College draws upon 400 years of experience and innovation in education from our Founder School, Dulwich College in London. Dulwich College provides expertise, resources and a rigorous set of academic standards to which all the international Colleges adhere. Our close ties with our sister schools in Beijing, Shanghai, Suzhou, Seoul and Zhuhai provide us with further access to resources and experience here in East Asia as well as further opportunities for professional development and movement between the Colleges. The College aims to inspire its students enhancing their education and cultural understanding. We want to prepare them for the opportunities available in a highly connected world. This global outlook is expressed in our motto ‘Detur Pons Mundo’, which translates to ‘Buidling bridges to the world’ and helps shape happy and confident boys and girls. For more information please access our website at https://singapore.dulwich.org/ The building is located at 71 Bukit Batok West Ave 8, Singapore 658966
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Highlights
Join a successful and growing international school
Be part of a dedicated and friendly team
Develop your career in an international school environment
Job Description
Dulwich College (Singapore) is looking for a dedicated Systems Administrator to join its ICT team. The Systems Administrator sits within the ICT Services Department and ensures a stable and secure infrastructure for the College’s systems and applications. In addition, he/she will maintain, review and optimise Information Communications and Technology (ICT) systems and processes. This position acts an escalation point for the Department, for third level complex technical support.

Duties will include, but are not limited to, the following:
Customer Service
Liaise with students, parents, and staff to provide consistent, efficient technical services in a courteous and friendly manner.
Provide uncomplicated information on technical issues.
Work in partnership with academic and administrative staff to support the technology requirements of the College.
Encourage customer feedback to plan future improvements of the services provided.
Be point of contact for all system related queries.
Liaise with the ICT Service Coordinator and ICT Manager to provide timely updates to the Community of system related outages.
Systems Administration
To ensure a stable and secure system infrastructure for the College's Development:
In conjunction with the Director of ICT and ICT Manager, develop and maintain plans for medium to long term system infrastructure, both hardware and software.
Take a key role in the development of the College Cyber Security strategy and promote appropriate safe access of systems.
Proactively maintain and manage Windows Server environments, including but not limited to Active Directory, DNS, DHCP, and Group Policy.
Oversee and optimize Microsoft Office 365 services, ensuring email reliability and security.
Monitor system performance, identify bottlenecks, and resolve issues promptly.
Develop, implement, and maintain robust backup solutions to protect critical data and ensure data integrity.
Create and test disaster recovery procedures to minimize downtime in case of system failures or emergencies.
Execute data restoration as needed, with minimal disruption to operations.
Maintenance
Ensure the highest level of system security, whilst emphasizing confidentiality at all times through:
Maintenance of user logins to the College systems.
Applying best practice in instigating protection against the risk of viruses/spam and spyware.
Maintain comprehensive documentation of system configurations, network diagrams, and standard operating procedures.
Provide training and guidance to staff and students on the use of technology tools and best practices.
Ensure the highest level of system operation through:
Ensuring the College’s systems are operating effectively including email, internet access, file-print services and others as required.
Providing technical input to management in relation to technical design.
Monitoring available resources and provide input for capacity planning.
Undertaking continuous review and improvement to ensure best practice approach to system administration.
Perform compatibility testing and upgrade of system software applications.
Implement and enforce security best practices across the IT infrastructure.
Stay current with security patches, updates, and vulnerabilities, applying necessary updates in a timely manner.
Conduct regular security audits, vulnerability assessments, and risk evaluations, and take corrective actions as required.
Technical Service
Investigate and resolve hardware and software issues on ICT equipment. This may be by remote support (telephone or return-to-base support) or on-site support (in-class or at-workstation support).
Perform minor hardware repairs on ICT equipment.
Perform compatibility testing and upgrade of software applications.
Participate in special projects assigned by the Director of Information Communication Technology.
Provide support for Network Administrator related tasks when required.
Be the escalation point for system related technical queries, liaise with third party vendors for investigation and resolution.
Communication
Provide regular feedback to clients on the status of on-going technical support issues.
Provide regular feedback to other ICT Engineers on on-going technical support issues through email messaging and departmental documentation.
Provide technical notes for communication to students, parents, and staff directly or via the ICT Service Coordinator
Participate in ICT Services staff meetings, Technical Service-Learning Technologies staff meetings and other meetings as required.
Provide detailed online documentation for completed technology.
Administration
Document hardware issues and utilise the Technical Support System to maintain records of repairs.
Management of System Contracts.
Maintain current documentation for College related system hardware and configurations.
Contribute to departmental policies and procedures.
Maintenance of OSH requirements within the department and classrooms.
Maintaining and creating documentation for the College Systems.
Create How to Documents for specific projects.
Service Delivery
To provide a high level of service to all customers (internal or external and including students, staff, parents, and general community members).
Ensuring a friendly, helpful, and professional demeanour at all times.
Creating positive and open communications to deliver the best possible outcome.
Ensuring systems and processes are optimised for efficiency and effectiveness whilst seeking ways to continuously improve how things are done.
Creating a reputation for reliability by fulfilling promises made.
Providing a timely response in all service delivery interactions.
Responding to a complaint as an opportunity for service improvement.
Taking ownership of a customer problem; follow it through to resolution, and follow-up to confirm the problem is resolved to their satisfaction.
The successful candidate will possess:
Bachelor’s degree/advanced Diploma/Diploma in information technology, Computer Science, or a related field. Relevant certifications such as MCSA, MCSE, or CompTIA Security are preferred.
Extensive knowledge of Windows Server operating systems, Active Directory, and Office 365 and familiarity with virtualization technologies e.g. Hyper-V, VMware (will be advantageous).
Strong problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and a proactive approach to IT management.
Proven experience as a Systems Administrator in a Microsoft-centric environment.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills for effective collaboration with diverse stakeholders.
A high level of system administration troubleshooting and general computing skills.
Ability to access and analyse information with excellent organisational and time management skills to prioritise and complete all tasks in an efficient manner.
Demonstrated high level of accuracy and attention to detail with confidence in assisting a diverse group of people including students.
Highly motivated and has a flexible approach to work.
We welcome and encourage applications from people of all backgrounds. Having a diverse staff body is a great strength to us as a College and one of the ways that we can help students achieve our College Mission of Living Worldwise. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, gender, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, pregnancy or socio-economic status. We support family-friendly flexible working opportunities, where operational needs allow. Staff recruited locally are subject to terms and conditions of service according to local employment law.
Dulwich College (Singapore) is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of all the students in our care and expects all applicants to share this commitment. We follow safe recruitment practices which are aligned to the recommendations of the International Task Force on Child Protection. We hold ourselves to a high standard of effective recruiting practices with specific attention to child protection. All appointments are subject to an interview, identity checks, criminal record checks, and successful references.
CPE Registration Number: 201027137D. Period of Registration: 09 January 2020 to 08 January 2024

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Your role :
Are you adept at implementing system changes? Do you have a proven record of working effectively with numerous technical teams to improve core infrastructure?

We’re looking for an IT system administrator to:

• propose and implement systems enhancements
• monitor usage and performance, and troubleshoot server, software, and hardware issues
• analyze complexity and feasibility of new or changed requirements
• within specified architecture, define platform requirement sizing, network and controlling components, and system software
• plan, evaluate, migrate, develop, implement, configure, test and roll out systems (hardware or software, networks, controls)
• analyze outages and defective states, initiating and monitoring measures to remedy them

Your team :
You’ll be working in the Global Hosted Services team in Singapore, Singapore. We provide remote access to virtual workspaces and hosted applications. As an IT system administrator, you’ll play an important role in monitoring, maintaining and continual service improvements to the infrastructure.

Your expertise :
• ideally 5+ years of experience working a large and complex web hosting environment, financial sector background would be a plus
• working knowledge of products like Citrix, VMware, HP Moonshot, Cloud Developer Desktop platforms (Azure).
• university degree computer science, management information systems or professional certifications
• analytical, logical and enjoy solving problems
• excellent communicator, able to adapt style and detail to the audience
• motivated, self-directed and driven

title: Senior / Systems Engineer, Asia
company: ARGUS MEDIA SINGAPORE GROUP PTE. LTD.
company_info: Argus is an independent media organisation with 1,300 staff. It is headquartered in London and has 29 offices in the world’s principal commodity trading and production centres. Argus produces price assessments and analysis of international energy and other commodity markets and offers bespoke consulting services and industry-leading conferences. Companies in 140 countries around the world use Argus data to index physical trade and as benchmarks in financial derivative markets as well as for analysis and planning purposes. Argus was founded in 1970 and is a privately held UK-registered company. It is owned by employee shareholders, global growth equity firm General Atlantic and Hg, the specialist software and technology services investor. Argus Media is committed to ensuring career and personal growth for all its staff and provides extensive training and career development opportunities, as well as participation in employee-led initiatives, including a women’s network. Our core values are Excellence, Integrity, Partnership and Inclusivity. What’s in it for you · Work within a highly motivated team at an industry-leading and rapidly growing global company · Competitive salary and company bonus scheme · A modern office environment designed to foster productivity, creativity, and teamwork · Excellent location at Raffles Place in central Singapore – close to public transport and amenities · Hybrid working model - Work from Home options available · Comprehensive benefits package including medical (GP and specialist), dental and hospitalisation. · 20 vacation days your first year, up to a maximum of 25 days · Extensive internal and external training · Employee Welfare & Employee Assistance Programme
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Argus is an independent media organisation with 1,300 staff. It is headquartered in London and has 29 offices in the world’s principal commodity trading and production centres. Argus produces price assessments and analysis of international energy and other commodity markets and offers bespoke consulting services and industry-leading conferences. Companies in 140 countries around the world use Argus data to index physical trade and as benchmarks in financial derivative markets as well as for analysis and planning purposes.
Argus was founded in 1970 and is a privately held UK-registered company. It is owned by employee shareholders, global growth equity firm General Atlantic and Hg, the specialist software and technology services investor. Argus Media is committed to ensuring career and personal growth for all its staff and provides extensive training and career development opportunities, as well as participation in employee-led initiatives, including a women’s network. Our core values are Excellence, Integrity, Partnership and Inclusivity.
What will you be doing?
We have an exciting opportunity for a friendly, enthusiastic problem-solver who loves to help people join our team in our growing Singapore office. Reporting to the Head of IT, you will be a critical player supporting a growing application, network and server infrastructure. The role encompasses various technologies, including AWS, Windows, Linux and Juniper MIST networking.
Your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:
Manage all components in our Microsoft O365 and Amazon Cloud Infrastructure (M365 & AWS)
Administration, Configuration and Troubleshooting of Juniper Network devices.
Work closely with DevOps team to ensure high availability.
Work closely with the security team to counter the ever-growing cyber-threat landscape.
Building new cloud and on-premise platforms and deploying improvements to existing ones.
Running and maintaining server & storage infrastructure on premises.
Running and maintaining network infrastructures.
Working with other internal teams to identify, manage and resolve issues and incidents.
Ensure architectural standards are maintained.
Participate on the Infrastructure/Operations On-Call Rotation Schedule.
Creating documentation and training material for the team.
What we’re looking for in you
We are looking for those who have an enthusiastic can-do attitude.
You will thrive in a small team environment and additionally demonstrate the following:
At least a Diploma holder in IT Computer studies field.
The willingness and ability to be “on call” per regional instruction.
At least 3 years of experience with Support Analyst, or related field, Windows Systems Administration, including deploying and managing servers in a multi-site domain environment.
Experience with Juniper network equipment including MIST network deployments.
Management of Certificate Services PKI, and Route 53 Internal/External DNS management.
Write and maintain project requirements and manage stakeholder expectations.
Experience with Microsoft Intune for Desktop Management and deployments.
Requires a good working knowledge of GitHub or use of other source control management systems.
Excellent understanding of certificates and PKI Infrastructure as well as services such as NDES.
Experience with Windows server 2012-2022 Administration and Management.
Experience with any variety of Linux.
Excellent understanding of security systems and security best practices.
Management of Microsoft O365 tenants, including Exchange, Office etc.
Experience with deployment of VOIP-based systems and MS Team VOIP technologies.
Ability to communicate across all levels of an organisation
Takes ownership of your work and follows problems through to resolution
Excellent time management skills
Able to work independently whilst also engaging and collaborating in line with the Argus values: Excellence, Integrity, Partnership, and Inclusivity
Preferred Qualifications (Bonus to have)
Experience with AWS Cloud Formation and AWS.
Experience of advanced cloud Networking Transit Gateway/Azure Express Route.
Good skills with Powershell & Python.
A good understanding of wired and wireless network design & deployment.
Experience with Juniper networking or CCNP level networking.
What’s in it for you
Work within a highly motivated team at an industry-leading and rapidly growing global company
Competitive salary and bonus in line with education, experience, and skills
A modern office environment designed to foster productivity, creativity, and teamwork
Excellent location at Raffles Place in central Singapore – close to public transport and amenities
Hybrid working model - Work from Home options available
Career development and promotion from within culture
Comprehensive benefits package including medical (GP and specialist), dental and hospitalisation.
20 vacation days your first year, up to a maximum of 25 days
Extensive internal and external training
Employee Welfare & Employee Assistance Programme
Hours
Monday through Friday, 10.00 a.m. to 7.00 p.m. and 11.00 a.m. to 8.00 p.m. (Shift)
Earlier or later hours, or weekend hours, may be expected on occasion.
We're not engaging any recruitment agencies for this role, so if you're interested, please apply directly.

title: IT Systems Administrator (II)
company_info: Officially launched in August 2018, YouTrip (www.you.co) lets travellers spend worldwide with the best rates every day in 150+ currencies and no fees. Ever. YouTrip is developed and operated by You Technologies Group, a regional financial technology startup based in Singapore, Thailand and Hong Kong, in collaboration with Mastercard.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are
YouTrip (www.you.co) is a Southeast Asian-focused fintech dedicated to creating the next generation of digital financial services for the region. With its consumer and corporate products, YouTrip and YouBiz, the company empowers users with the most affordable and convenient financial innovations. The company is a Major Payment Institution licensed by the Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS), and owns principal memberships and issuing licenses with two of the largest card schemes, MasterCard and Visa. It was recognised as a Top FinTech Leader at the SFF Global FinTech Awards 2021 and awarded Best Multi-Currency Mobile Wallet Provider at the APAC Insider’s 2022 Singapore.

Our culture is entrepreneurial, open & inclusive, and teamwork-oriented. We are looking for talents with the aspiration to thrive in a rapidly growing business in the exciting FinTech space.
We’re looking for a tech-savvy IT System Administrator to join our team and provide IT system setup and technical support to our employees. The IT Administrator will be responsible for setting up IT system infrastructure, troubleshooting and resolving IT-related issues, managing our wired and wireless office network infrastructure, and working with vendors and internal teams to ensure our IT systems are up-to-date and secure. The ideal candidate should have strong problem-solving skills and a thorough understanding of information technology, including hardware, software, networking, and information security.

What you will be doing
Install, configure, and maintain both hardware and software systems including variety of SaaS based and internal applications, such as Slack, Google Workspace, AWS WorkSpaces, Github, JIRA, Confluence, VPN
Troubleshoot, and resolve IT-related hardware and software issues reported by internal users, and manage the process of support ticketing
Monitor network and system performance, including network security and security logs
Be the IT liaison for new hires, assist to create accounts and set up hardware for new hires
Train users on new hardware and software
Support audio and video equipment in office
Manage the life cycle and purchase forecast of corporate assets to ensure accurate inventory records
Support the network equipment setup and optimization in the office, troubleshoot issues with the network and ISP vendors
Work with internal teams or vendors to resolve technical issues
Support information security audits
What we are looking for
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Networking or other related disciplines.
At least 3 years of related work experience
Good working knowledge of cloud infrastructure, networking, information security, computer systems, hardware, and software
Experience supporting hardware and software issues on Mac, Windows, and Linux operating systems
Working knowledge of networking protocols and setup, such as ethernet, wireless network, TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, and VPN
Experience in IT asset & inventory management
Experience with modern SaaS tools and open-source software is desirable
Ability to work collaboratively and communicate effectively with internal and external teams
What we offer
An innovative culture that encourages talents to work highly collaboratively in a respectful, friendly environment
Access to a deep bench of technical and business experts that work together
Working with an entrepreneurial team of people in Singapore, Thailand and Hong Kong

title: System Administrator
company_info: About us Computer Guys is a service company. We are on a mission to simplify technology and to empower our users and customers. We are committed to setting the defining standards for IT services. We place ourselves at the forefront of revolution in infrastructure maintenance and user support. Challenging the status quo and focused on providing dedicated service to people, rather than machines. To us, its all about people.
job_category: Consulting, Customer Service, Information Technology, Professional Services
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Who Are We Looking For

We're looking for someone to provide game changing services to our customers. Resourceful, independent and strong follow up skills are key qualities in this position.
You will be interacting with customers, responding to their needs. Gather customer’s information and determine the issue by evaluating and analysing the symptoms. You will follow up and make scheduled callbacks to customers where necessary. You will help build, maintain and troubleshoot the client's infrastructure. You will be working alongside other engineers to ensure highest levels of client service delivery.

Your Duties & Responsibilities

● Provide Level 1 / 2 IT support to end users (onsite / remotely)
● Provide front-line IT support to employees via walk-ups, tickets, and MS Teams
● Maintain accurate ticketing processes and asset management tracking records
● Provide emergency requests / VVIP support outside of business hours
● Monitor, troubleshoot, and repair IT hardware and software
● Handle hardware and software sourcing / purchasing
● Write and update technical documentation for end users and the IT team
● Assist in Projects / Audits based task given by the IT team
● Liaising with 3rd party vendors

You're Good At

● Good interpersonal skills
● Highly adaptable and flexible
● High level of ethics, values, integrity and trust
● High proficiency in both written and spoken English

Will Be Awesome If You Are/Have

● Highly disciplined and productive when working independently
● Takes initiative to identify gaps and develop solutions to close the gaps
● Good in follow up and follow through to complete tasks
● Powershell / CMD Line Scripting
● Deployment Knowledge (SCCM/Intune/Custom Imagings/Software Centers)
● Windows Server Knowledge

Qualifications

● Minimum 2 years of experience providing IT support in a corporate environment
● Experience in supporting and troubleshooting Windows 10, MS Office, Windows Server (ADFS/LDAP/WSUS) in a business environment

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Position: Senior Systems Engineer (12 months Contract)
Work Location: Central Singapore
Job Description:
Administer and support system operations on-premise and cloud IT Infrastructure.
Analyse, troubleshoot, and resolve issues pertaining to supported technologies and related services within SLA.
Collaborate with project stakeholders and technical teams. Effectively communicate technical changes and enhancements that may impact the infrastructure.
Participate in planning, design, and implementation of changes to Active Directory, File Server, IIS Infrastructure, and other supported technologies.
Carry out maintenance tasks such as patch updates and configuration changes to mitigate vulnerabilities.
Standardization and automation of systems, tasks, and workflows using Ansible, Python, and PowerShell.
Document processes and procedures, ensure these are adhered to throughout the supported environments.
Provide on-call 24x7 support on rotational basis.
Job Requirement:
Min. 5 years relevant experience as Level 2/3 Systems Administrator.
Hands-on experience in enterprise systems administration of Windows Servers, particularly setup and management of Active Directory, File servers, and IIS.
Experience in setup and migration of Active Directory and File servers; management and troubleshooting of Load Balancers, DNS, Web Application Firewall, Web Proxy, and Virtual Desktops.
Preferably with experience in management and troubleshooting of Linux servers, Tomcat, and Apache HTTP.
Knowledge and experience working on these various products are preferred: AWS, Citrix ADC, BlueCat DNS, Imperva SecureSphere, CyberArk, RSA AM, and Cisco ESA.
Able to write scripts in PowerShell / Python for automation of administrative tasks.
Strong communication and documentation skills.
Team player, takes ownership of tasks and works independently with limited supervision.
Able to perform well in a high-pressure environment.
Willing and eager to learn new technologies.
Please share resume to yeowling@onelinkhr.com for processing.
Please note that by submitting an application or resume to us, you would be deemed to have given your consent to us in collecting, using, retaining and disclosing your personal information to prospective employers for their consideration.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Role - Systems Administrator (Windows and Azure)

Role Objectives:
• Maintain essential IT operations, including server and client operating systems, security tools, applications, servers, email systems, laptops, desktops, software, and hardware
• Handle business-critical IT tasks and systems that provide commercial advantage in a global marketplace
• Enable faster and smarter business processes and implement analytics for meaningful insights
• Protect business interests by implementing and managing IT Security solutions.
• Nurture dependable IT infrastructure and networking that’s always up and running.
• Partner with internal and external partners to communicate project status, activities, and achievements.

Daily and Monthly Responsibilities:
• Perform server administration tasks (for on-premise and cloud infrastructure), including user/group administration, security permissions, group policies, print services, research event log warnings and errors, and resource monitoring, ensuring system architecture components work together seamlessly.
• Monitor servers and application health using pre-existing management tools and respond to hardware issues as they arise; help build, test, and maintain new servers as needed.
• Maintain internal infrastructure requirements including, laptop and desktop computers, servers, routers, switches, firewalls, printers, phones, security updates; support internet, intranet, LANs, WANs, and network segments.
• Interact with the help desk and other teams to assist in troubleshooting, identify root cause, and provide technical support when needed.
• Perform routine/scheduled audits of the systems, including all backups.

Skills and Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s degree or recognized Diploma in technology or computer science.
• Candidates with Microsoft Certifications preferred.
• Proven work experience in IT - primarily Microsoft platform (on-premise and cloud)
• In-depth knowledge of Windows Servers, Operating systems, current equipment and technologies, Office 365 Administration, system performance-monitoring tools, managing active directories, virtualization (Hyper-V), HTTP traffic, content delivery, and caching
• Experience in managing cloud infrastructure on Azure, migrating servers and active directory to Azure.
• Expertise in creating, packaging, and deploying virtual servers and client devices.
• Knowledge of managing SAN, DAS, and NAS storage solutions.
• Experience in optimizing networking and connectivity devices and solutions.

Work Experience:

5+ Years relevant experience

description:

Facilitate all software modifications and upgrades as part of the software maintenance to upkeep smooth operations of the system.

Identify and escalate priority issues.
Redirect problems to appropriate resource.

Coordinate with local equipment supplier/vendors (system related).

Review monthly operations statistics together with the Manager.
Provide monthly system performance analysis and generate required reports for stakeholders
Develop and maintain installation and configuration procedures where necessary.

Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent.
Certifications in supporting relevant technologies such as MCP, MCSE and CCNA will be a definite advantage.

Experience in a control room environment preferred.
General understanding of the underlying operating system, e.g., VMware, Windows and Linux.
General understanding of storage technologies, memory management, disk arrays, NAS/SAN, networking.
Must be a strong team player and able to work independently, with curiosity and strong problem-solving skills.
Able to travel overseas if required.
Possess strong communication skills in English.

title: Lead Engineer (Control Systems)
company_info: LONZA BIOLOGICS TUAS PTE. LTD.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Posted Job Advert
Today, Lonza is a global leader in life sciences operating across three continents. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of.

Did you know that we are the 1st biologics contract manufacturer in Singapore? We offer you exposure to upcoming biotech and established pharmaceutical companies and to the manufacturing technology needed to produce mammalian treatments and cell therapies of tomorrow. Our global manufacturing network is recognized for its reliable, high-quality services, regulatory track record, global footprint, innovative technology platforms and extensive experience – we, in Singapore are proud to be part of this global network.

The Lead Engineer is responsible for the introduction of automation control systems used to support GMP manufacturing of biologics products, providing subsequent system administration and maintenance oversight of these control systems and associated networks upon transitioning to operation phase.

Key responsibilities:
Perform system administration and routine maintenance activities, including but not limited to user access management, system monitoring, software configuration, backup and recovery for control systems and networks.
Perform troubleshooting and provide support to resolve control system-related issues and failures; interactions with system vendors as necessary.
Identify performance and security gaps to ensure computerized system integrity and proactively seeks out improvements and solutions.
Oversight of control system policies and procedures to ensure alignment with current regulatory expectations.
Conduct control system user training to Lonza staff.
Provide office as well as after-office hours support (based on on-call rotation) to ensure smooth operation of the control systems supporting GMP production.
Provide assistance to Engineering Support Team, Manufacturing, MSAT where cross-functional support is required for troubleshooting/root cause finding.
Own and perform TrackWise deviation investigations and write-up on control system failures/errors; deviation trend review and root cause analysis as required per Lonza Quality requirements.
Assist management in assessing TrackWise change requests, computerized system change controls and participate in control system change management process.
As Control Systems SME to support technology transfer and other site capital projects by performing scoping of control system-related changes; plan and execute changes within project timelines.
Lead control systems Factory Acceptance Tests (FAT), Site Acceptance Tests (SAT) and support subsequent site qualification activities as needed.
Familiarity with 21 CFR Part 11 and EU Annex 11 requirements, data integrity requirements and expectations as well as common industry practices with respect to GMP computerized system administration and management.
Support the team on inspection readiness at all times.
Perform periodic reviews with respect to user authorizations and system audit trails.
Support Data Owners in data audit trail reviews in terms of electronic data retrieval.
Any other duties as assigned by Supervisor / Manager.
Key requirements:
Degree/Diploma in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems or Equivalent.
Experience with control systems such as Emerson DeltaV, Rockwell FactoryTalk, PlantPax, Allen Bradley and Siemens.
Experience with various Windows operating systems, server-client architecture and control system-related infrastructure fundamentals.
Good understanding and knowledge in automation design and code development best practices.
Strong problem solving and analytical skills.
Good communication skills.
A team player, with the ability to work across functional teams.

Every day, Lonza’s products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically.

People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.

title: Senior Executive, Administration
company_info: A research-intensive public university, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) has 33,000 undergraduate and postgraduate students in the Engineering, Business, Science, Humanities, Arts, & Social Sciences, and Graduate colleges. It also has a medical school, the Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, established jointly with Imperial College London. NTU is also home to world-class autonomous institutes – the National Institute of Education, S Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth Observatory of Singapore, and Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering – and various leading research centres such as the Nanyang Environment & Water Research Institute (NEWRI) and Energy Research Institute @ NTU (ERI@N). Ranked amongst the world’s top universities by QS, NTU has also been named the world’s top young university for the past seven years. The University’s main campus is frequently listed among the Top 15 most beautiful university campuses in the world and has 57 Green Mark-certified (equivalent to LEED-certified) buildings, of which 95% are certified Green Mark Platinum. Apart from its main campus, NTU also has a campus in Novena, Singapore’s healthcare district. Under the NTU Smart Campus vision, the University harnesses the power of digital technology and tech-enabled solutions to support better learning and living experiences, the discovery of new knowledge, and the sustainability of resources. For more information, visit www.ntu.edu.sg
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About NTU Singapore
Young and research intensive, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) is home to various world-class institutes and a living testbed of tomorrow’s technologies and a model of sustainability. NTU envision itself to be a great global university founded on science and technology, nurturing leaders and creating societal impact through interdisciplinary education and research.
About Office of Research & Technology in Defence and Security (ORTDS)
ORTDS serves as NTU’s main interaction point with collaborators in the area of Defence & Security, working closely with various units in NTU to strategically identify future critical research areas, capabilities and educational opportunities. ORTDS adds value to the defence and security research community through a diverse range of activities, by facilitating interactions across all operational domains in NTU.
About the Role
ORTDS invites suitable candidates to join this department as a Senior Executive, Administration. Reporting into the Executive Director, the ideal candidate should be adaptable and agile. The broad job scope would require a generalist that is willing to pick-up or already has a wide range of administrative skills, exceptional organizational abilities, and the ability to handle tasks with discretion and professionalism. This role provides opportunities to understand various functions in NTU, such as research administration, events management and the continuous learning landscape.
Responsibilities:
Events Management - Coordination of engagements (e.g. visits, meetings, workshops, etc.) between NTU and external stakeholders
Scheduling and programme preparation
Liaising and facilitation between various parties
Logistics and actual day event management
Course Coordination - Facilitation and execution of training courses through engaging instructors, learners and other departments or entities
Timetabling and other required paperwork
Working with Learning Management System (e.g. blackboard)
Running the courses & providing learner support
Supporting a Community of Practice
Emailing List management
Notice and event EDM Blasts
Research Administration - Supporting and coordinating a research programme through grant administration
Documentation preparation and stakeholder point of contact for grant queries
Oversight and summary of programme-level status
Research Management System administrator
Preparing grant account reports
Claims processing & invoicing
General Administration - Executing a broad spectrum of day-to-day operational administrative tasks
Procurement (e.g. Ariba)
Facility usage verification, billing and accounting
User and usage database maintenance and management
Requirements:
Diploma or a Bachelor's degree in business administration, science or engineering is preferred
At least 1 year’s experience, preferably in administrative role
Proficient in using Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook); experience with SAP, Ariba, or any research management system and learning management system will be a plus
General understanding on workflows for procurement and financial administration, experience with research grant workflow will be a plus
Prior experience in planning and leading meetings and visits; experience in larger events will be a plus
Good communication and interpersonal skills; as well as being user or service oriented
Excellent organizational, time management and planning skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks effectively
Ability to handle confidential information with discretion, and exercise tact and diplomacy
Conscientious, detail-oriented with a high level of accuracy
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment
Interested to meet and interact with people
High adaptability and interest to be exposed to a broad spectrum of activities and scope
If you are a motivated and adaptable individual with a passion for administrative work, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.
This position will be on 1 year contract.

Job Description

Individual will be part of the Server deployment function of TIs-Patching & Currency Team. This function is responsible for deployment of security patches, OS upgrades and other critical application upgrades across the Enterprise servers.

title: Systems Engineer (Microsoft 365)
company_info: Upper Spring Consulting is a Talent Search/Headhunting firm based in Singapore. We are a team of experienced and qualified Human Resource & Business Consulting practitioner. We specialise in positions related to Information Technology, Banking and Healthcare industry and domain.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are representing our client in the Shipping industry to look for an experienced Systems Engineer to complement the existing team. As part of the global IT team, the System Engineer will support the business needs of the organization. The successful candidate will be working together with the Network, Security and Software development team members to ensure that system hardware, operating systems, software systems, and related procedures comply with internal and external standards and security requirements.

Responsilbilities
Perform day-to-day operational functions in support of the Microsoft 365 environment. Serve as a MS365 administrator and subject matter expert, managing and maintaining the MS365 infrastructure, applications, and related technologies.
Perform system administration duties in Hybrid cloud environment; Hyper-V/VMware virtualization, Microsoft Windows server, Microsoft Azure Cloud and Microsoft SQL.
Monitor and ensure optimal system performance for potential bottlenecks, identify possible solutions, and ensure system’s availability and reliability in Production environment.
Perform system patching and ensuring that systems are safe and secure against cybersecurity threats.
Perform data management and backup duties for both on-premise and cloud systems and applications.
Assist with Vulnerability Assessment & Penetration Test (VAPT) and IT audit exercise with security team members and external vendors.
Involve in the planning and execution of annual IT DR drills.
Provide escalation support per request from various sources; investigate and troubleshoot issues.
Participate in on-call escalation rotations for 24x7x365 support; evening, overnight, and weekend, holiday and on-call work may be required.
Requirements
Minimum Diploma in Computer Science or equivalent discipline.
Relevant certification in MS365 certification is preferred.
3 years of relevant experience as a System Engineer.
Exposure with Azure, Active Directory, Intune, Teams, OneDrive, SharePoint, Exchange online and other Microsoft 365 product suite.
Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Windows Server, Hyper-V virtualization and databases.
Good understanding of cybersecurity principles include conditional access and cloud application security
Experienced with backup tools like Commvault, Azure Backup.
Proficiency in PowerShell, Azure CLI and other scripting language.
Basic knowledge in network infrastructure

title: Linux Systems Administrator
company_info: MaxLinear is a global, New York Stock Exchange-traded company (NYSE: MXL) where the entrepreneurial spirit is alive and well. We are a fabless system-on-chip product company, designing highly integrated, radio-frequency, and mixed-signal Communications ICs for broadband and infrastructure applications. We hire the best people in the world and engage them in some of the most exciting opportunities in our broadband and infrastructure markets. Our growth has come from innovative, bold approaches to solving some of the world’s most challenging communication technology problems. MaxLinear began by developing the World’s first high-performance TV tuner chip using standard CMOS process technology. Others said we couldn’t achieve the extremely high performance requirements using CMOS, but we proved them wrong and achieved enduring global market leadership with our designs. Since then, we’ve developed a full line of products for satellite communications, cable modems, and terrestrial TV; diversified into high speed products addressing Datacom applications such as 400 Gbps fiber-optic interconnect chips for high-speed networks; and MoCA technology for home networking. Our headquarters is in Carlsbad, near San Diego, California. We also have major design centers in Irvine and San Jose, CA; in Vancouver, Canada; in Herzliya, Israel; in Valencia, Spain; and in Bangalore, India. We have approximately 800 employees, a substantial majority of whom have engineering degrees, and include masters and Ph.D. graduates from many of the premiere universities around the world. Our engineers thrive on innovation, outstanding execution, outside-the-box thinking, nimbleness, and collaboration. Together, we form a high-energy business team that is focused on building great products.

company_info: EZ-LINK PTE LTD We are a company that places people at the forefront of the cashless transformation. Our workplace is where ideas are given the opportunity to take root, blossom and make an impact in the world. Into our 15th year of cashless leadership in Singapore, we seek individuals who dare to imagine, think and do.
