Join us and be part of the team to continuously push the boundaries of innovation to produce exciting products and services, enhancing journeys and delighting customers in Singapore and beyond.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
You will enable the transformaton of our Cloud development and operaons practices. As a Senior Specialist, you should have a solid understanding of Cloud services (System / Network / Security) and be able to lead a team of cross‐functional application developers, infrastructure engineers, and security specialists to promote cloud‐first architecture and implementations. You will also be responsible for supervising teams to create an atmosphere of trust; seeking diverse views to encourage improvement and innovation; participating in various cloud enablement and advocacy activites, and coaching associates on various deployment models of Cloud. You should be able to implement large‐scale cloud implementations and effectively address information governance and security challenges associated with running workloads on public clouds.

Job Description:
Provide cloud security architecture support for build, migration, and operation of Azure cloud infrastructure or other cloud infrastructure (AWS, Google)
Research and evaluate emerging cloud technologies and proac􀆟vely recommend areas where they can bring business value
Develop aspects of the cloud migration initiative, including its impact on infrastructure, and manage / operate cloud system, networks, and security
Define standards and best pratices by conducting POCs for new cloud technologies leveraged by the development organization and engineering teams
Develop a baseline for deliverables to include; network access, restriction of internet‐facing resources within the cloud platform, provision and configure computer resources within Azure environment
Provide expertise and serve as subject matter expert regarding Cloud for both infrastructure and applications in Microsoft Azure
Work with application teams with their digital Transformation goals and achieve exceptional results retaining maximum associate satisfaction
Work with the IT Security Team, Solution Architects and Security Operations teams with any security‐related issues
Develop, maintain and drive a culture of continuous enhancement for a robust knowledge management system for the Cloud Operations team
Establish a continuous improvement plan for Cloud Operations, including technology reviews, root cause analysis, action reports analysis, and cloud portfolio review to ensure adequate infrastructure to provide a suitable operating environment(s) for critical applications
Conceptualizing, presenting and executing ideas within a tight schedule, with particular emphases on serving as a technical lead on development projects with on‐prem and cloud, or a team lead or architect across multiple software development projects
Demonstrate extensive abilities as a lead: supervising teams to create an atmosphere of trust; seeking diverse views to encourage improvement and innovation; participating in various cloud enablement and advocacy activities, and coaching associates on various deployment models of Cloud
Proven extensive ability to develop Cloud strategy; as well as write, communicate, facilitate, and present cogently; to and/or for all levels of IT audiences, and management, including presentations, training, and executive briefings
advise application team with azure security
develop a migra􀆟on strategy for azure security components and overall application components
define the operating procedure in a cloud environment
support with performance tuning and testing activity
Minimum of 1 year as a contributor to the design of distributed and highly available cloud solutions
An ideal candidate should have the following:
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related analytical field, or equivalent experience
Minimum of 2 years of deploying and supporting cloud services in a large‐scale environment
Minimum of 2 years of experience in one or more cloud providers
Minimum of 2 years of experience writing in a scripting language that implemented a deployment to the cloud or supported a cloud workload
Minimum of 1 year experience working with relational SQL databases and/or NoSQL databases
Practical knowledge of web application security
An interest in learning new technology
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Strong ability to work with different teams and to prioritize tasks
Able to work independently with integrity under minimal supervision and effectively within a team
Provide innovative ideas to the team & strong team player
It would be advantageous if you have knowledge in:
Microsoft Azure Cloud Administration. Other cloud platform administration will be added advantages
Systems Administration for Windows / Azure Active Directory / Linux
Knowledge in migration to Azure Cloud
Knowledge in DevSecOps and Agile practice
Knowledge in Infrastructure as a Code using terraform

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
NCS is a leading information and communications technology (ICT) and communications engineering services provider across the Asia-Pacific region. We are headquartered in Singapore and a wholly owned subsidiary of the Singtel Group. We have in-depth domain knowledge and unique capabilities that create business value for customers. We offer a broad range of services, including consulting, systems development and integration, business process outsourcing, infrastructure management and solutions, and technology solutions.
Job Role:
The Senior Systems Engineer with Redhat / RHEL skills is responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining complex IT infrastructure systems, with a focus on Redhat technologies. The role involves analyzing and optimizing existing IT systems, providing technical support and troubleshooting assistance, and ensuring the availability, reliability, and security of IT infrastructure.

Project Delivery

• Gather business and/or application requirements on the infrastructure, conduct impact analysis, suggest design/re-design to integrate the change into the existing environment
• Test systems in accordance to specifications & service level. Where relevant, perform the necessary system programming & configuration
• Manage systems changes through established change request process & provide status reports to the relevant parties
• Respond promptly to incident, investigate & provide temporary &/or permanent resolution of incidents escalated. Provide timely status updates to relevant parties
• Conduct root cause analysis & implement pro-active measures. Monitor effectiveness of implemented measures
• Monitor & measure the performance & availability of systems proactively;
• implement corrective actions identified to improve performance & availability
• Monitor the agreed service level (.e.g. service request, system availability), document & maintain the configuration of the systems; provide regular reporting to relevant parties
• Execute service continuity measures, e.g. backup/restore procedures & disaster recovery plan dry run to ensure continuous operation of the business
• Ensure the management of ICT systems adhere to established ISO20000 & ISO27001 processes / procedures and ITIL best practices / ITSM and methodologies (e.g. change management, release management, incident management, problem management, configuration management)
• Manage budget, resources and schedule for system implementation / operation activities; ensure deliverables meet client requirements and quality standards
• Established facility management standards/best practices to ensure operation consistency across project/facility management teams

The mandatory skill is Redhat and optional skill is Ansible, docker and Kubernetes.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
You will enable the transformaton of our Cloud development and operaons practices. As a Senior Specialist, you should have a solid understanding of Cloud services (System / Network / Security) and be able to lead a team of cross‐functional application developers, infrastructure engineers, and security specialists to promote cloud‐first architecture and implementations. You will also be responsible for supervising teams to create an atmosphere of trust; seeking diverse views to encourage improvement and innovation; participating in various cloud enablement and advocacy activites, and coaching associates on various deployment models of Cloud. You should be able to implement large‐scale cloud implementations and effectively address information governance and security challenges associated with running workloads on public clouds.

Job Description:
Provide cloud security architecture support for build, migration, and operation of Azure cloud infrastructure or other cloud infrastructure (AWS, Google)
Research and evaluate emerging cloud technologies and proac􀆟vely recommend areas where they can bring business value
Develop aspects of the cloud migration initiative, including its impact on infrastructure, and manage / operate cloud system, networks, and security
Define standards and best pratices by conducting POCs for new cloud technologies leveraged by the development organization and engineering teams
Develop a baseline for deliverables to include; network access, restriction of internet‐facing resources within the cloud platform, provision and configure computer resources within Azure environment
Provide expertise and serve as subject matter expert regarding Cloud for both infrastructure and applications in Microsoft Azure
Work with application teams with their digital Transformation goals and achieve exceptional results retaining maximum associate satisfaction
Work with the IT Security Team, Solution Architects and Security Operations teams with any security‐related issues
Develop, maintain and drive a culture of continuous enhancement for a robust knowledge management system for the Cloud Operations team
Establish a continuous improvement plan for Cloud Operations, including technology reviews, root cause analysis, action reports analysis, and cloud portfolio review to ensure adequate infrastructure to provide a suitable operating environment(s) for critical applications
Conceptualizing, presenting and executing ideas within a tight schedule, with particular emphases on serving as a technical lead on development projects with on‐prem and cloud, or a team lead or architect across multiple software development projects
Demonstrate extensive abilities as a lead: supervising teams to create an atmosphere of trust; seeking diverse views to encourage improvement and innovation; participating in various cloud enablement and advocacy activities, and coaching associates on various deployment models of Cloud
Proven extensive ability to develop Cloud strategy; as well as write, communicate, facilitate, and present cogently; to and/or for all levels of IT audiences, and management, including presentations, training, and executive briefings
advise application team with azure security
develop a migra􀆟on strategy for azure security components and overall application components
define the operating procedure in a cloud environment
support with performance tuning and testing activity
Minimum of 2 years as a contributor to the design of distributed and highly available cloud solutions

An ideal candidate should have the following:
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related analytical field, or equivalent experience
Minimum of 3-4 years of senior people leadership
Minimum of 4 years of deploying and supporting cloud services in a large‐scale environment
Minimum of 4 years of experience in one or more cloud providers
Minimum of 4 years of experience writing in a scripting language that implemented a deployment to the cloud or supported a cloud workload
Minimum of 2 years experience working with relational SQL databases and/or NoSQL databases
Practical knowledge of web application security
An interest in learning new technology
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Strong ability to work with different teams and to prioritize tasks
Able to work independently with integrity under minimal supervision and effectively within a team
Provide innovative ideas to the team & strong team player
It would be advantageous if you have knowledge in:
Microsoft Azure Cloud Administration. Other cloud platform administration will be added advantages
Systems Administration for Windows / Azure Active Directory / Linux
Knowledge in migration to Azure Cloud
Knowledge in DevSecOps and Agile practice
Knowledge in Infrastructure as a Code using terraform

We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

title: Operations Support Engineer (OSS Fulfilment and Inventory System)
company_info: StarHub is Singapore's fully-integrated info-communications company, offering a full range of information, communications and entertainment services for both consumer and corporate markets. StarHub operates a mobile network that provides 4G, 3G and 2G services. It also manages an islandwide HFC network that delivers multi-channel pay TV services (including HDTV, Internet TV and on-demand services) as well as ultra-high speed residential broadband services. StarHub operates an extensive fixed business network that provides a wide range of data, voice and wholesale services. Over Singapore’s fibre-based Next Generation Nationwide Broadband Network, StarHub offers a broad range of home and business broadband plans along with a host of advanced media-rich value-added services, such as IPTV for commercial entities. Launched in 2000, StarHub has become one of Singapore's most innovative info-communications providers, and the pioneer in 'hubbing' - the ability to deliver unique integrated and converged services to all its customers. StarHub, listed on the main board of the Singapore Exchange since October 2004, is a component stock of the Straits Times Index and the MSCI Singapore Free Index.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities

Our client is one of the leading ship-owning companies and they are looking for a proactive & experienced System Engineer to join their IT Department. The successful candidate will work with the Network, Security and Software Development team members to ensure that system hardware, operating systems, software systems, and related procedures comply with internal and external standards and security requirements.

Responsibilities
Perform day-to-day operational functions in support of the Microsoft 365 environment. Serve as a Microsoft 365 administrator and subject matter expert (SME), managing and maintaining the M365 infrastructure, applications, and related technologies.
Perform system administration duties in Hybrid cloud environment; Hyper-V/VMware virtualization, Microsoft Windows server, Microsoft Azure Cloud and Microsoft SQL.
Monitor and ensure optimal system performance for potential bottlenecks, identify possible solutions, and ensure system’s availability and reliability in Production environment.
Perform system patching and ensuring that systems are safe and secure against cybersecurity threats.
Perform data management and backup duties for both on-premise and cloud systems and applications.
Assist with Vulnerability Assessment & Penetration Test (VAPT) and IT audit exercise with security team members and external vendors.
Involve in the planning and execution of annual IT DR drills.
Provide escalation support per request from various sources; investigate and troubleshoot issues.
Participate in on-call escalation rotations for 24x7x365 support. Evening, overnight, weekend, holiday, and on-call work may be required.

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology or equivalent.
Microsoft 365 Administrator (MS-10x) certification is preferred.
Microsoft Azure Administrator (AZ-104) certification is a plus.
Microsoft Certified Windows Server Hybrid Administrator Associate (AZ-80x) is an advantage.
5+ years of relevant experience as a System Engineer.
Mid to senior level exposure with Azure, Active Directory, Intune, Teams, OneDrive, SharePoint, Exchange online and other Microsoft 365 product suites.
Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Windows Server, Hyper-V virtualization and databases.
Solid understanding of cybersecurity principles including conditional access and cloud application security.
Familiar with backup tools like Commvault, Azure Backup.
Proficient in Microsoft Visio and documentation.
Proficiency in PowerShell, Azure CLI, and other scripting languages.
Basic knowledge of networking & security concepts.

Others

UK MNC, good corporate culture and 5-day work week (centralized location).
With AWS and variable bonus.

We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Hands-on experience in VM operations will be favourable
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Have an affinity for vulnerability management
Effective time management and organizational skills
Team player, including ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships within and across the organization

title: L2 System Engineer (AD Administrator)

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The L2 System Engineer (AD Administrator) is responsible for:
• Creation/deletion/management of AD objects
• Creation/troubleshooting/management of Group Policy Object (GPO)
• Assisting the Support Engineer or Software Engineer in problem resolution beyond the capability of the 1st Level Support Staff.
• Performing system recovery if needed.
• Escalating unsolvable problems to the 3rd Level Support Staff and reports the escalation to superior.
• Ensuring that the System runs according to contractual specifications after problem resolution.
• Providing advice on system / database performance monitoring and tuning.
• Ensuring deployments of approved patches/releases are implemented accordingly to Change Request.
• Complete all Service Requests accordingly to SLA timeframe.
• Assisting the Customer in the verification, isolation and/or provision of a temporary work-around for the problem logged beyond 2nd Level Support Staff capability.
• Escalating unsolvable system problems and service request to the OEM/Vendor for technical support.
• Coordinating system development tasks to include design, integration and formal testing on the Change Request.
• Overseeing all transitions into production on the Change Request.
• Developing and complete actions in system specifications, technical and logistical requirements and other disciplines on the Change Request.
• Creating and maintain programmatic and technical documentation to ensure efficient planning and execution on the Change Request.
• Managing and document system configurations on the Change Request.
• Perform troubleshooting and resolve incident based on SLA.
• Generating the relevant administrative records and reports.
• Standby after office hour.

Job Requirements:
• Degree/Diploma in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent, although consideration will be given to experience and certifications in lieu of degree.
• Minimum 3 to 5 years IT experience
• Past working experience in Cloud environment is an advantage
• Able to handle demanding service response and recovery turnaround
• Able to manage daily support tasks to meet stringent SLA requirements
• Excellent scheduling and multitasking skills
• Meticulous and process-oriented
• Good, hard-working attitude with ability to work well under pressure
• Good communication skills English (written, spoken)
• Good analytical skills with ability to work with others to resolve problems.
• Good organization skills, with ability to properly document and track information.
• Preferably with Microsoft Certification and/or ITIL certification.
• Dynamic, customer oriented, experience working in a fast paced environment.
• Good Knowledge of following products will be advantageous:
- Linux, Unix, Active Directory/DNS, Microsoft Azure Stack, Microsoft Windows 2008-2022, Commvault Backup and Recovery, Symantec Endpoint Protection
- Microsoft Azure HCI Technologies including Hyper-V, Failover Clustering, Storage Space Direct, Software Defined Network will be in great advantage

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
My client, a financial service company is looking to growing their IT team. A skilled and adaptable System Administrator with expertise in Red Hat Linux, Windows, and UNIX environments. Office location is at Tampines

As a System Administrator in IT Operations Team, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the stability, security, and optimal performance of our organization's diverse computing systems. Your proficiency in managing and troubleshooting these platforms will be pivotal in maintaining a robust and efficient IT infrastructure.

Role
Manage, monitor, and maintain the health of servers, workstations, and other IT systems running on Red Hat Linux, Windows, and UNIX platforms.
Install, configure, and upgrade operating systems, software applications, and utilities across various environments.
Perform routine system administration tasks, including user management, access control, file system maintenance, and system backups.
Monitor system performance and resource utilization, identifying and addressing bottlenecks to ensure optimal system responsiveness.
Diagnose and resolve technical issues related to hardware, software, and network components, collaborating with cross-functional teams as needed.
Implement and maintain security measures to safeguard systems against unauthorized access, vulnerabilities, and cyber threats.
Plan and execute system patching, updates, and upgrades to maintain a secure and up-to-date computing environment.
Respond to system alerts and incidents, performing root cause analysis and implementing corrective actions to prevent recurrence.
Document system configurations, procedures, and troubleshooting steps for internal knowledge sharing and reference.
Provide technical support to end-users, assisting them with system-related inquiries, issues, and training as necessary.
Participate in capacity planning and scalability assessments to ensure system resources meet current and future requirements.
Collaborate with vendors and third-party service providers to manage hardware and software procurement, maintenance, and support contracts.
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related field. Relevant certifications (Red Hat Certified Engineer, Microsoft Certified: Azure Administrator, etc.) are a plus.
Proven experience as a System Administrator, with a focus on managing Red Hat Linux, Windows, and UNIX environments.Proficiency in shell scripting and automation to streamline system administration tasks.
Solid understanding of networking concepts, protocols, and troubleshooting in a mixed-platform environment.
Experience with virtualization technologies (VMware, Hyper-V, etc.) and cloud platforms is beneficial.
Familiarity with system monitoring and management tools (Nagios, Zabbix, Ansible, etc.).
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to analyze and resolve complex technical issues.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, to interact with technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Detail-oriented mindset with a commitment to maintaining accurate documentation and records.
Ability to work effectively in a team environment and adapt to evolving technologies and business needs.
Prior experience in ITIL or other IT service management frameworks is advantageous.



APPLY NOW! Interviews are ongoing! Email to dayna.chiam@stellar-link.com
We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates would be notified.
Chiam Lee Ping Dayna
Consultant
Reg. No: R1764404
Stellar- Link Partners Pte Ltd (EA License: 21S0698)

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
JOB DESCRIPTION

We are looking for a Systems Engineer to maintain, upgrade and manage software, hardware and networks. Resourcefulness is a necessary skill in this role. You should be able to diagnose and resolve problems quickly. You should also have the patience to communicate with a variety of interdisciplinary teams and users. Your goal will be to ensure that our client’s technology infrastructure runs smoothly and efficiently.

Your responsibilities include:

· Manage network servers and technology tools
· Set up accounts and workstations
· Monitor performance and maintain systems according to requirements
· Troubleshoot issues and outages
· Ensure security through access controls, backups and firewalls
· Upgrade systems with new releases and models
· Health check reporting


JOB REQUIREMENTS

· Minimum Diploma in Information Technology, Computer Science or a related discipline; professional certification (e.g. Microsoft Certified Systems Administrator (MCSA)) is a plus
· At least 2 years’ experience in similar capacity as a System Administrator, network administrator or similar role.


REQUIRED SKILL-SET

· Experience with networks (LAN, WAN) and device patch management
· Knowledge of system security (e.g. intrusion detection systems) and data backup/recovery
· Familiarity with various operating systems and platforms
· Resourcefulness and problem-solving aptitude
· Excellent communication skills

title: System Engineer
company_info: GLAMCO Aviation Pte Ltd prides itself as a leading solutions provider for the Aerospace, Commercial and Defence & Security industries. Established in Singapore since 1985, GLAMCO provides component repair & overhaul, spares support, specialised products and other related consultancy services to Aircraft operators, Defence and Security agencies, Civil Airport and Seaport Operators. Representing Aircraft Manufacturers, Systems OEMs, Stocking distributors and OEMs worldwide, we are able to support Programme Management, quick response and delivery. GLAMCO has also expanded its activities to include the supply of specialized equipment for the Navy, Army as well as Civil Airport and Seaport.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are searching for a System Engineer to be part of our diverse team here in Glamco. Our System Engineers are key component of our operations by providing technical support, testing, installation, training, support and maintenance services for our programs in Singapore. In addition, the System Engineer shall support the Program / Project Manager on the project and system maintenance life cycle from pre-sales to maintenance.
Candidates must show initiative, highly independent, hands-on, aspiration for increase role and responsibilities, and a demonstrated willingness to work in a team.

Job Responsibilities:
Reporting to the Program / Project Manager, the System Engineer will be using their expertise and experience to support both internal Glamco and external Customer activities for our Singapore commercial program. Specific responsibilities but not limited to the following includes:
· Provide system engineering and networking support to our programs in Singapore including but not limited to hardware and software configuration and set up, troubleshooting networks and system defects, and fielding technical questions about hardware and software
· Manage and provide onsite and remote customer support including system and infrastructure installation, configuration, testing, training, maintenance, site-surveys etc
· Provide system engineering and networking expertise to our programs in Singapore during pre-sales and post-sales
· Develop, prepare and conduct test cases for customer’s program
· Develop and maintain technical and configuration documentation, training materials and user manuals
· Serve as a Technical Support expert and capable of handling escalations, incidents, outages and infrastructure challenges.
· Evaluate and upgrade system hardware and/or firmware with consultation with program partners. Perform system patching and deployment.
· Lead and manage a team of Technical Officers to provide technical and maintenance support to clients
· Support the Program / Project Manager to manage the project and system maintenance lifecycle from Proposal development to Project Kickoff to Initial Design to Development and Testing to Customer Acceptance Testing to System Maintenance Program
· Support the Business Development Team in determining project scope of work
· Ensure project and maintenance SLA (Service Level Agreement) and customer satisfaction levels are met
· Maintain standard operating procedures (SOP), processes and guidelines
· Maintain security, backup and redundancy strategies
· Research new technologies and solution in support of the programs
· Any other technical, operations or project related duties that may be required

Requirements
· Diploma or Degree in Information Technology or Computer Engineering or related field
· Minimum of 3 years working experience in IT Support, Network, Systems, Cyber Security type function
· Knowledge or experience with network and system administration including firewall and network infrastructure topology, networking protocols, routing and switching, and firewall configuration
· Knowledge or experience with server and workstation administration
· Checkpoint Firewalls, PaloAlto Firewalls, Fortinet Firewall, Cisco Switches, HP Aruba Switches, VPN Technologies, DNS, NTP, 2 Factor Authentication technologies
· Experience in running projects are plus points
· Strong interest and experience in the field of Radar and Radio Frequency (RF) technologies are plus points
· Good English and Mandarin interpersonal, oral and written communications skills are required
· Hardware, software and technical aptitude
· Strong analytical and critical thinking skills
· Show initiative, self-discipline, excellent judgment, career aspirations for increased role and responsibilities, a demonstrated willingness to work as a team with the ability to work independently
· Willing to perform potential shift duties, weekends and overtime
· Willing to travel overseas to support overseas requirements
· Willing to work in an SME environment
· Must possess Class 3 Manual driving license
· Singaporean only


About Glamco:
GLAMCO Aviation Pte Ltd (GLAMCO) prides itself as a leading solutions provider for the Aerospace, Commercial, Air & Maritime Traffic Management and Defence & Security industries. Established in Singapore since 195, GLAMCO provides component repair and overhaul, spares support, specialized products and other related consultancy services to Aircraft operators, Defence and Security agencies, Civil Airport and Seaport Operators.

Representing Aircraft Manufacturers, Systems OEMs, Stocking Distributors and OEMs worldwide, we are able to support Programme Management, quick response and delivery. GLAMCO has also expanded its activities to include the supply of specialized equipment for the Navy, Army, as well as Civil Airport and Seaport. Since 2020s,

GLAMCO has further expanded our services to provide logistics management (warehouse), system engineering and maintenance support to our customers.

To learn more about us and our products, please visit our website at www.glamco.com.sg.
If you are ready to make an impact, email your contact information and current resume to: freddie.goh@glamco.com.sg. Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

title: Systems Analyst / Software Engineer
company_info: JEPPESEN ASIA/PACIFIC PTE. LTD. As a global, multi-cultural company Jeppesen Systems provides many opportunities to grow, on a personal level as well as professionally. The company culture is creative, straightforward, dynamic, friendly and fun with a diverse team cooperating in achieving challenging tasks. Our clients include KLM, SAS, British Airways, Singapore Airlines, Delta Airlines, Virgin Atlantic Airways, Deutsche Bahn and DSB. We participate in joint research and software development at some of the world’s leading universities. Read more at www.jeppesen.com/carmen For more than 70 years Jeppesen has made it possible for pilots and their passengers to safely and efficiently reach their destinations. Today this pioneering spirit continues as Jeppesen delivers essential information and optimization solutions to improve the efficiency of air, sea and rail operations around the globe. Jeppesen is a subsidiary of Boeing Commercial Aviation Services, a unit of Boeing Commercial Airplanes. Jeppesen corporate information is available online at www.jeppesen.com
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Who You Are
You are passionate about the Airline Crew and Ops business. You see yourself contributing in a team and believe a team is more than the sum of its team members. You enjoy communicating with different stakeholders as part of the project delivery, being self-driven and support the goals of the entire team. You like to challenge yourself and others, actively speaking out, seeking answers and listening. You like to work in a flat hierarchy structure. You are adaptive, thrive in a dynamic environment, and see change as something positive

About Us
One third of pilots and cabin crew worldwide are flying with schedules produced by Jeppesen's innovative solutions. One million pilots use our navigation products, and every day some 70,000 routes around the world are planned with the help of Jeppesen solutions.

At Jeppesen, a subsidiary of Boeing, you will work with breakthrough technology, exciting customers and fantastic colleagues from around the world. Our products comprise best-of-breed solutions that break down silos, enable more effective workflow, and amplify cross-functional collaboration within the airline. Our culture is characterized by creativity, professionalism and self-organization within an open, diverse and flexible work environment.

We believe that our employees must be allowed to dream big and have fun for us to remain one of the top companies in the industry. We encourage and enable our employees to continuously develop their professional skillset and explore new areas. We are focusing on continuous improvements and innovations to bring more value to our clients in the future.

About The Position
The Digital Services and Support (DSS) Implementation department is responsible for development and delivery of our Crew and Ops management products to airline customers. We are looking for Systems Analyst/Software Engineer to join our department based in Singapore. This is an opportunity to be part of an enthusiastic team that solve some of the most challenging airline’s planning and operational problems.

In this position, you will work closely with our clients and develop applications to meet their business needs. We are looking for applicants with strong communication skills who can drive technical solutions decision in a confident way. The candidate should be good at dealing with technical challenges as well as handling client expectations and building long-term customer relations. Your responsibilities will include requirement gathering, software customization, optimization modelling, testing and continuous improvement on the value proposition of our products.

All positions will be based in Singapore and the candidate needs to be able to travel to our customers from time to time as part of the job, mainly within APAC region. We support hybrid working model.

Our teams are currently hiring for a broad range of experience levels including; Experienced and Senior Level Systems Analyst/Software Engineer.

Basic Qualifications
Degree in Computer Science/Computer Engineering/Electrical and Electronics Engineering/Information Systems or other relevant major with equivalent experience
Comfortable working in Unix / Linux environment
Adept in Python or similar languages
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Thrive working in a self-organized team structure
Preferred Qualifications
Master's or Bachelor's degree is desired
Experience with Unix / Linux system administration, shell scripting, database, GitLab, CI/CD
Experience working within a Scrum team or in similar Agile project setup
Airline Crew/Ops Management knowledge
Jeppesen Crew/Ops products customization experience
Relocation
This position offers one-time relocation. Benefits and pay are determined at the local level and are not on Boeing US-based payroll

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
My client, a financial service company is looking to growing their IT team. A skilled and adaptable System Administrator with expertise in Red Hat Linux, Windows, and UNIX environments. Office location is at Tampines

As a System Administrator in IT Operations Team, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the stability, security, and optimal performance of our organization's diverse computing systems. Your proficiency in managing and troubleshooting these platforms will be pivotal in maintaining a robust and efficient IT infrastructure.

Role
Manage, monitor, and maintain the health of servers, workstations, and other IT systems running on Red Hat Linux, Windows, and UNIX platforms.
Install, configure, and upgrade operating systems, software applications, and utilities across various environments.
Perform routine system administration tasks, including user management, access control, file system maintenance, and system backups.
Monitor system performance and resource utilization, identifying and addressing bottlenecks to ensure optimal system responsiveness.
Diagnose and resolve technical issues related to hardware, software, and network components, collaborating with cross-functional teams as needed.
Implement and maintain security measures to safeguard systems against unauthorized access, vulnerabilities, and cyber threats.
Plan and execute system patching, updates, and upgrades to maintain a secure and up-to-date computing environment.
Respond to system alerts and incidents, performing root cause analysis and implementing corrective actions to prevent recurrence.
Document system configurations, procedures, and troubleshooting steps for internal knowledge sharing and reference.
Provide technical support to end-users, assisting them with system-related inquiries, issues, and training as necessary.
Participate in capacity planning and scalability assessments to ensure system resources meet current and future requirements.
Collaborate with vendors and third-party service providers to manage hardware and software procurement, maintenance, and support contracts.
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related field. Relevant certifications (Red Hat Certified Engineer, Microsoft Certified: Azure Administrator, etc.) are a plus.
Proven experience as a System Administrator, with a focus on managing Red Hat Linux, Windows, and UNIX environments.Proficiency in shell scripting and automation to streamline system administration tasks.
Solid understanding of networking concepts, protocols, and troubleshooting in a mixed-platform environment.
Experience with virtualization technologies (VMware, Hyper-V, etc.) and cloud platforms is beneficial.
Familiarity with system monitoring and management tools (Nagios, Zabbix, Ansible, etc.).
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to analyze and resolve complex technical issues.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, to interact with technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Detail-oriented mindset with a commitment to maintaining accurate documentation and records.
Ability to work effectively in a team environment and adapt to evolving technologies and business needs.
Prior experience in ITIL or other IT service management frameworks is advantageous.



APPLY NOW! Interviews are ongoing! Email to dayna.chiam@stellar-link.com
We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates would be notified.
Chiam Lee Ping Dayna
Consultant
Reg. No: R1764404
Stellar- Link Partners Pte Ltd (EA License: 21S0698)

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description
Support the global AS400 platform
Deliver 1st to 3rd level service support as part of the Incident, Problem and Change Management process
Produce engineering and technical standards for AS400 platform
Provide infra-related support to the Application/Business Support team in managing their solutions which are currently hosted in the AS400 platform. (i.e., EuroPaladign for CH, Fusion Midas/Trust System in APAC, Olympic (EMEA), Paladign (UK), & GMI(ETD)
Prepare capacity and performance management services
Arrange support for AS400 Product Management
Handle License and Asset Management
Steer Infrastructure Solution Design
Manage continuous service improvement through automation, standardization, and process reviews.
Ensure that security and compliance requirements are met with the scope of agreed policies and standards.
Sign-Off ITSCM validation test plans and ensure the coordination with the business partners.

Job Requirements
Confidence and deep experience of OS/400 V7.2 or higher, IBM Power Systems, SAN Storage (V7000 and etc.), high availability systems (e.g., icluster, MIMIX, Vision Solutions and etc.)
Technical expertise on system configuration (SW & HW), HW & OS installations/upgrades including OS build, PTF planning and management
Solid OS400 security management (User Profiles, Objects, system values & etc.)
Able to write and maintain scripts and automation utilities (CLP). Experience of high-level languages such as RPG, RPGLE (a bonus).
Experience on service-oriented architecture (SOA) and REST (representational state transfer) architecture.
Demonstrate knowledge on BRMS, Tape encryption (using SKLM), Tapeless solution (EMC Data Domain and etc.) and existing key management infrastructure.
Knowledge and experience on leading edge iSeries tools like PowerTech products, Q message monitor, RAMi, etc.
Experience on performance measurement, analysis, and amendments.
Passion for developing technical standards and maintaining good documentation
Ability to liaise with IT Security, IT Risk and GIA and external auditors on security/compliance related issues and vulnerabilities.
Previous experience working in complex infrastructure projects like Cloud Migration is a plus
Ability to work on 24 x 7 on-call support

You are
A committed and visionary team player with analytical and logical mind-set (you can solve problems like nobody’s business)
Well organized with an innate sense of how to prioritize across a complex environment
A hands-on person with natural instincts to support our customers
Curious, collaborative, and constantly interested in learning new things
Fluent in English and eager to work in an English-speaking global team
Able to work in a diverse and mature team and can collaborate and support other team members locally and globally

- Operate the infrastructure tools like Puppet and GIT
- Manages the backup and recovery platform

- Excellent written and oral communication skills
- Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities
- Ability to effectively prioritise and execute tasks in a challenging environment
- Highly self-motivated and capable of working autonomously
- Team-oriented and skilled in working within a collaborative environment

Roles & Responsibilities
Responsibilities: 
To perform installation, maintenance and monitoring of Solaris, AIX, Linux, Windows Servers, http web servers, J2EE application servers, MS-IIS, MQ and Crystal Report servers.  To support daily operations of the production application systems including duty rostering supports, health monitoring, monthly reports, OS and security patching, recover system failures, troubleshoot failure root causes, and periodically security assessments and enhancements.  To work closely with project application development teams and external vendors to ensure the successful implementation of new projects and systems service requests.  To embrace new technologies such as Cloud, containers, etc. for new systems/projects  Successful candidate will work with the system team in a fast-paced environment, along with various dynamic project teams on high profile mission-critical systems.  To assist DBAs in troubleshooting JDBC related issues at J2EE application servers.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Programme description:
Billing Systems is a national programme for Patient charging and billing.

Roles and Responsibilities:

1. Manage day-to-day activities in the Program Management Office (PMO) such as project governance and tracking of milestones and completeness of documentation
2. Maintain and provide guidance on project governance standards and guidelines
3. Drive deliverable management and gate closures across program
4. Support finance and procurement in invoicing and procurement
5. Support project reporting in meeting coordination and preparation and minute taking
6. Drive vendor and internal delivery teams to adhere to project governance standards
7. Schedule regular meetings and record action items and decisions (e.g. assigned tasks and next steps)
8. Assist in planning and organizing Billing Transformation Project Team related events (e.g. for team building purpose)
9. Work with a team of Project Managers and Project Coordinators, so good communication and collaboration skills are essential.

1. Minimum Diploma holder
2. Experience in office administration supporting multiple directors, project administration support function and calendar management.
3. Added advantage with secretariat experience with procurement and basic accounting knowledge.
4. Meticulous in planning, strong coordination skills, good communication (written and spoken) and following thru with actions and escalation.

company_info: SP Group is a leading utilities group in the Asia Pacific, empowering the future of energy with low-carbon, smart energy solutions for its customers. It owns and operates electricity and gas transmission and distribution businesses in Singapore and Australia, and sustainable energy solutions in Singapore, China, Vietnam and Thailand. As Singapore's national grid operator, about 1.6 million industrial, commercial and residential customers benefit from its world-class transmission, distribution and market support services. These networks are amongst the most reliable and cost-effective world-wide. Beyond traditional utilities services, SP Group provides a suite of renewable and sustainable energy solutions including solar energy solutions, microgrids, cooling and heating systems for business districts and residential townships, electric vehicle fast charging and green digital energy management tools for customers in Singapore and the region.

With 14 wholly owned offices and depots spanning Asia to North America, we pride ourselves on maintaining a strong global service network. At Hostmost Group, we believe in continuous improvement and invest in staff training to stay ahead of industry trends and requirements. description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Key Responsibilities:
Provide technical support for PC, server, network and system infrastructure to company’s local office as well as overseas offices.
Maintaining IT operations such as applications, email systems, hardware, software, and network security tools
Responsible for the infrastructure setup, administration and maintenance
Spotting inefficiencies in an organization’s computer network and making recommendations to address weaknesses
Monitor and perform proper remedy actions to ensure the stability, reliability, security and performance improvement of the whole infrastructure
Manage system storage, backup and restore operation
Perform feasibility study on market solutions and technologies for continuous improvement
Prepare and maintain documentation

Qualifications required:
Recognized degree/diploma or equivalent in Information Technology
Engineering or related discipline with at least 10 years’ relevant experience in system & network administration
Good written and verbal communication skills
Able to work well independently
Possess a strong interest and self-motivation to install, configure and maintain system/network services, equipment and devices, provide system/network support and request, investigate, troubleshoot issues and provide resolution, i.e. including managing user accounts and access
Competent and having a sound knowledge (Configure and troubleshoot) of various network protocols and topologies, including a broad knowledge of WLAN, switches, routers, servers, IPS/IDS and firewalls
Able to perform network monitoring, verifying the integrity and availability of all hardware, network resources, systems and key processes, reviewing system and application logs, and verifying completion of scheduled jobs such as backups, and related administration tasks;
Able to administer anti-virus, anti-spam and network security system
Experience with implementing the network devices hardening requirements
Relevant experience in monitoring and reviewing performance of network and ability to perform capacity planning
Certifications in CCNA and or CCNP would be beneficial
If you are ready to take on this exciting opportunity and contribute to the growth of our organization, please submit your resume, along with a cover letter outlining your relevant experience and why you believe you are the ideal candidate for this position.

We look forward to reviewing your application and discussing how you can make a significant impact as our Network and Computer System Administrator.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
JOB SUMMARY
This role is responsible for maintaining a reliable, secure, and efficient data communications network, and for caring, feeding, and maintaining our critical backend systems. This role is also responsible for the configuration, maintenance and operation of network, servers, desktop, and storage infrastructure, ensuring that the company’s network and all related equipment are functional to accommodate system users. Successful candidates must be resourceful, detail-oriented, and self-directed, with a passion for understanding their clients' business. Outstanding listening skills, genuine interest in fostering teamwork, a willingness to provide honest feedback, and extreme ownership are keys to the success of our projects.

Job Description:
Fully support, configure, maintain, and upgrade corporate networks and in-house servers.
Hands-on technical troubleshooting capabilities. Ability to work independently under minimal supervision.
Knowledge of computing infrastructures, including AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud environments.
Lead desktop and helpdesk support efforts, making sure all desktop applications, workstations, and related equipment problems are resolved in a timely manner with minimal disruption to business.
Responsible for capacity, storage planning, and database performance.
Install and integrate new server hardware and applications, keep an eye out for needed updates.
Support and administer third-party applications. Ensure network security and connectivity.
Monitor network performance (availability, utilization, throughput, and latency) and test for weaknesses.
Set up user accounts, permissions, and passwords. Resolve problems reported by end users.
Define network policies and procedures. Specify system requirements and design solutions.
Research and make recommendations on server system administration.
Monitor scheduled jobs and computer output for completeness, accuracy, and errors.
Perform all critical data backups and secure data according to best practices and established procedures.
Install firmware and security updates on servers, printers, and related networking equipment.
Configure and maintain Firewall, Anti-Virus, Anti-Spam, Anti-Malware, etc. for maximum internal network protection.
Maintain all data used for redundancy efforts and assists with remediation efforts as result of test findings and risk assessments.
Log all computer, terminal, and printer hardware/software problems. Call appropriate maintenance organizations and arrange for repair. Notify supervisor of unusual problems.
Assist with software upgrades and installations. Create scripts for automation of common tasks.
Provide network support with a variety of operating systems. Implement and manage disaster recovery and back-up.
Evaluate and recommend security improvements and system upgrades.
Monitor network to ensure optimal performance.
Test release of products to minimize user impact and ensure compatibility.
Create technical support documentation for systems and applications.
Proven network engineering, network operations, and network performance analysis skills.
Zoho and other backend systems
Job Requirements:

Minimum Bachelor Degree in Information Technology
Minimum 3 years experience in network administrator role
Hands on experience in networking, routing, and switching.
Excellent knowledge of best practices around management, control, and monitoring of server and Cloud infrastructure.
Ability to set up and configure server hardware.
Familiarity with backup and recovery software and methodologies
Great at organizing, prioritizing, and multitasking.
Experience with scripting and automation tools.

title: Wintel System Administrator
company_info: JOBSTER PRIVATE LTD.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
**Job Description: Wintel Systems Administrator**

**Position Overview:**
The Wintel Systems Administrator is responsible for the design, deployment, maintenance, and support of Windows-based server systems and associated technologies within an organization. This role involves managing the Windows server infrastructure, ensuring its stability, security, and optimal performance. The Wintel Systems Administrator collaborates with various IT teams to ensure seamless integration of Windows systems with other platforms, applications, and services.

**Key Responsibilities:**

1. **Server Infrastructure Management:**
- Deploy, configure, and manage Windows server environments, including physical and virtual servers.
- Install, configure, and maintain server hardware and software components.
- Monitor system performance and resource utilization to ensure optimal operation.
- Conduct regular system updates, patches, and security enhancements.

2. **Active Directory and Domain Services:**
- Administer Active Directory services, including user and group management, access controls, and security policies.
- Manage domain controllers, DNS, DHCP, and other related services.
- Implement and maintain Group Policy Objects (GPOs) to enforce security and configuration standards.

3. **Security and Compliance:**
- Implement security best practices to safeguard Windows server environments.
- Perform regular security audits, vulnerability assessments, and penetration testing.
- Respond to and mitigate security incidents and breaches.

4. **Backup and Recovery:**
- Develop and execute backup and disaster recovery strategies for Windows servers.
- Ensure data integrity and availability through regular backups and restoration testing.
- Develop and maintain documentation of backup procedures and recovery plans.

5. **System Monitoring and Troubleshooting:**
- Monitor system logs and performance metrics to identify and resolve issues proactively.
- Investigate and troubleshoot server-related incidents and outages.
- Provide timely resolution to system-related problems and escalations.

6. **Collaboration and Communication:**
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate Windows systems with other technologies and services.
- Communicate effectively with colleagues, management, and end-users regarding system changes, maintenance schedules, and incident updates.

7. **Capacity Planning and Performance Optimization:**
- Analyze server capacity and performance trends to forecast future resource requirements.
- Plan and implement server upgrades, hardware refreshes, and scalability enhancements.

8. **Documentation and Knowledge Sharing:**
- Maintain accurate documentation of server configurations, procedures, and troubleshooting guides.
- Contribute to internal knowledge base and share best practices with other team members.

**Qualifications and Skills:**

- Diploma/Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or related field (or equivalent experience).
- Proven experience as a Windows Systems Administrator in enterprise environments.
- Proficiency in Windows Server operating systems (e.g., Windows Server 2016, 2019) and related technologies.
- Familiarity with Active Directory, Group Policy, DNS, DHCP, and other Windows server roles.
- Knowledge of security practices, vulnerability assessment, and patch management.
- Experience with virtualization technologies (e.g., VMware, Hyper-V).
- Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.
- Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.
- Relevant certifications (e.g., MCSA, MCSE, CompTIA Server+) are a plus.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
My client, a financial service company is looking to growing their IT team. A skilled and adaptable System Administrator with expertise in Red Hat Linux, Windows, and UNIX environments. Office location is at Tampines.

As a System Administrator in IT Operations Team, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the stability, security, and optimal performance of our organization's diverse computing systems. Your proficiency in managing and troubleshooting these platforms will be pivotal in maintaining a robust and efficient IT infrastructure.

Role
Manage, monitor, and maintain the health of servers, workstations, and other IT systems running on Red Hat Linux, Windows, and UNIX platforms.
Install, configure, and upgrade operating systems, software applications, and utilities across various environments.
Perform routine system administration tasks, including user management, access control, file system maintenance, and system backups.
Monitor system performance and resource utilization, identifying and addressing bottlenecks to ensure optimal system responsiveness.
Diagnose and resolve technical issues related to hardware, software, and network components, collaborating with cross-functional teams as needed.
Implement and maintain security measures to safeguard systems against unauthorized access, vulnerabilities, and cyber threats.
Plan and execute system patching, updates, and upgrades to maintain a secure and up-to-date computing environment.
Respond to system alerts and incidents, performing root cause analysis and implementing corrective actions to prevent recurrence.
Document system configurations, procedures, and troubleshooting steps for internal knowledge sharing and reference.
Provide technical support to end-users, assisting them with system-related inquiries, issues, and training as necessary.
Participate in capacity planning and scalability assessments to ensure system resources meet current and future requirements.
Collaborate with vendors and third-party service providers to manage hardware and software procurement, maintenance, and support contracts.
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related field. Relevant certifications (Red Hat Certified Engineer, Microsoft Certified: Azure Administrator, etc.) are a plus.
Proven experience as a System Administrator, with a focus on managing Red Hat Linux, Windows, and UNIX environments.Proficiency in shell scripting and automation to streamline system administration tasks.
Solid understanding of networking concepts, protocols, and troubleshooting in a mixed-platform environment.
Experience with virtualization technologies (VMware, Hyper-V, etc.) and cloud platforms is beneficial.
Familiarity with system monitoring and management tools (Nagios, Zabbix, Ansible, etc.).
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to analyze and resolve complex technical issues.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, to interact with technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Detail-oriented mindset with a commitment to maintaining accurate documentation and records.
Ability to work effectively in a team environment and adapt to evolving technologies and business needs.
Prior experience in ITIL or other IT service management frameworks is advantageous.

We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates would be notified.

• Has Microsoft Certification and/or ITIL certification.

• Good command of English language, written and spoken.
• Good analytical skills with ability to work with others to resolve problems.

• Able to support stand-by or after office hours.

title: Remedy Developer and Administrator
company_info: Established in 1992, Goldtech Resources Pte Ltd is a fast expanding business and management consultancy providing the staffing bridge between job seekers and employers to achieve successful job placement to cater client’s business solution requirements. description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description:

• Responsible for the development, implementation, and sustained support of the IT Service Management system.
• Organize databases and other information storage architecture using Remedy software.
• Provide creative solutions to resolve business problems via customer requirements based on system capability, process gaps (ITSM/ITIL) and cultural challenges.
• Provide on-going technical assistance, handling incident tickets on a priority basis, software configuration/customization assistance including, but not limited to: screen tailoring, workflow administration, report setup, data imports, LDAP integration, custom scripting and third party software integrations.
• Transferring applications across infrastructure, developing storage solutions.
• Consulting with clients and other managers about the kinds of answer they are seeking.
• Managing Foundation data.
• Create new and modify existing reports and dashboards.
• Develop and implement new functionality determined necessary to support ITIL processes.

Requirements:

• Minimum Bachelor's degree in Computer Sciences, or an IT-related field.
• Preferably with working knowledge of BMC Remedy/HP SM ITSM tool.
• 3-5 years systems administration experience with at least 2 years’ experience in workflow customization.
• Working knowledge of Active Directory, LDAP, AJAX, CSS, XML, HTML, Oracle, and Java Script experience a plus.
• Experience in the management of all phases of the application lifecycle and best practices to include requirement gathering, design, development, testing (application code and user acceptance), and deployment.
• Solid understanding of ITSM processes and Integration techniques.
• Willing to standby and provide after office hour support when needed.
• Writing test scripts.
• Working knowledge of relational databases.
• Application Development experience (e.g. SDLC, Agile Scrum, etc.).

title: Analyst - Retail System
company_info: Senoko Energy Pte Ltd provides energy for life to generations of Singaporeans, delivering safe, innovative, and efficient energy supply to customers since 1977. Integral to Singapore’s development, Senoko Energy is a pioneer in power generation and energy solutions, serving Singapore’s energy needs with proven reliable performance. As the largest power generation company by installed capacity in Singapore, Senoko Energy has a licensed capacity of 3,300 megawatts (MW), providing about 20 per cent of the nation’s electricity needs. Senoko Energy was the first power generation company in Singapore to import clean natural gas for power generation in 1992, and first to launch a combined cycle plant in 1996. Senoko Energy is a staunch supporter of environmental sustainability through various CSR programs in Singapore and has contributed to a 42 per cent reduction in its carbon footprint since 2000. Senoko is also the winner of the inaugural Singapore Energy Award in 2013 and is ISO certified in business continuity, business processes, environmental and work safety, quality, amongst others. Senoko Energy has subsidiaries providing retail of electricity and related services, fuel storage tank leasing and terminal services, and gas operations services. Senoko Energy Pte Ltd is owned by a consortium comprising Marubeni Corporation, ENGIE, The Kansai Electric Power Co. Inc., Kyushu Electric Power Co. Inc. and Japan Bank for International Cooperation. Visit www.senokoenergy.com for more information.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
You will be the systems analyst for a suite of applications and their associated business processes. This is a techno-functional role and you will serve both (1) as a business process analyst and (2) as an applications subject matter expert performing applications design, implementation, support, operations and maintenance, and (3) as a project lead who will run project(s) / SDLC under your charge.

As a business process subject matter expert, you will work with business counterparts to identify areas where business processes can be improved through IT systems. You will then design and deliver those systems functionalities.

As an applications subject matter expert, you will perform day-to-day systems administration for these systems, and support the use of these systems. You will also be responsible for systems maintenance and application operations, and managing and regular reporting on the systems and resources in your area. You will need to work with many stakeholders and partners including our 3rd party technology partners, and end users.

Your Role:
1. Business process analysis and design (IT business analysis)
a. To develop actionable insights in business processes, and business data used for decision making and controls in the areas of frontend content management, customer relationship management and digitization.
b. To design and rollout improvements to business processes and data in the above areas, that are enabled and implemented through software and information technology
c. To work with business to develop dashboards and self-service business analytics capabilities.

2. Application and Enhancement design and implementation (IT business analysis)
a. Requirements and Specifications
To discover, elicit and analyse requirements
To write functional and software requirements specifications
b. Design
To design and document application and data architectures
To design application enhancements (or applications functionality)
c. Build and Quality
To build scripts and code fragments to implement enhancements
To manage the delivery of software engineering artefacts from vendors
d. Test and Rollout
To test and rollout enhancements on systems
To conduct tests (SIT, UAT and other tests)
e. Train and Enable
To train users and develop documentation on the use of systems
To write user manuals, and to conduct user training
f. Transition to Operations
To write technical documentation and procedure manuals
3. Application Management (Technical systems ownership)
a. Lifecycle management
Planning, design and implementation of overhauls, refactoring and upgrades to ensure system technical stack operates only using manufacturer supported components (no EOL components in production)
b. Fitness-for-purpose
TO-BE applications master plan: to produce and update a 3-year application masterplan to provide a business fit-for-purpose applications ecosystem for the business.
Planning, design and implementation for capacity growth
c. Fitness-for-operations
Operations processes and procedures: To design and put in place operations procedures for applications systems
Uptime and availability: To design applications, in conjunction with infrastructure, to achieve 99.8% uptime availability.
Cybersecurity: To design applications, that in conjunction with infrastructure designs, comply with cybersecurity architecture and information security policies and directives.
Disaster Recovery: To design applications, that in conjunction with infrastructure architecture, comply with disaster recovery architecture and strategy, to allow RPO and RTOs to be achieved.
d. Application architecture
Application architecture and configuration: To maintain up-to-date (1) logical architecture, (2) software and component inventory, (3) configuration register, and (4) definitive media library for all applications under management.
Data schema: To maintain up-to-date data architecture and schema documentation for the systems under management.
4. Application and Data maintenance (Technical systems ownership)
a. Maintenance plans and procedures: to design and execute maintenance plans and procedures, to keep systems fit-for-operations

b. Software maintenance
Software defect resolution: to rectify all defects in applications and underlying software platforms or implement workarounds if manufacturers do not provide defect rectification patches.
Software overhaul and refactoring:
(1) to plan and execute application maintenance and overhaul for all systems under management to ensure that no end-of-life components are in use in production, and
(2) to achieve 99.8 % uptime availability (excluding planned downtime).
c. Data maintenance:
To plan and execute data profiling and data quality analysis
To plan and execute master data maintenance jointly with business users
To plan and execute operational data maintenance jointly with business users, to upkeep data integrity and application fitness-for-purpose.
d. Systems cybersecurity posture and DR capability maintenance:
To execute configuration, patching, hardening and other maintenance activity in conformance with cybersecurity TAC prescriptions
DR capability maintenance: To maintain DR records and keep them up to date monthly, and to execute the annual DR exercise to demonstrate that DR capability is operational.
5. Application Operations (Application operations)
a. Systems monitoring and tuning:
To monitor application operations
To tune applications performance in response to monitoring, and in line with performance guidelines
b. Systems operations and administration:
Daily systems administration, including writing scripts and code elements
Plan and execute systems disaster recovery operations
Batch and Daemon operations: To plan, execute and document batch operations and daemon/service upkeep operations
c. System patching and upgrades:
Plan and execute component and system upgrades
Plan and execute systems patching on both an emergency ad-hoc basis, and for routine systems patching cycles
d. Data patching and cleansing:
To carry out and document data cleansing operations periodically with business users, to upkeep data quality and fitness for purpose
To carry out data-patching operations regularly, in response to business user requests
6. Project management
Requirement discovery and analysis (requirement gathering)
Gap analysis, scoping and solution design
Project planning, costing and scheduling
Project resource management
Project procurement management
Project implementation and control
Project quality management
Project risk management
Project tracking and reporting
Post project review
7. Domain / areas of coverage: covering systems and processes in the following areas:
Sales, E-commerce, Point of Sales systems
Frontend content management system
Sales operations systems
Customer relationship management systems
Product design, management and analytics systems
Digitization and K2 Workflow
Your Profile:
Degree in IT Computer Science or Equivalent
Fresh graduates are welcome to apply
The offered job grade/designation will be based on candidate’s experience, competencies and skillsets
Skills and competencies
Experience with business requirement gathering work is a must
Experience in an operational environment dealing with enterprise billing systems is essential
Experience in business analysis and systems analysis work is a must
Experience in one full project and/or Software Development Lifecycle is essential
Experience in business analytics is desirable
Some experience in the following is a plus:-
Experience in Sitecore or other CMS and frontend development
Experience in Microsoft Dynamics 365 or other CRM system
ITIL certification
PMP certification
CBAP certification
Attributes
Intellectual curiosity and analytical. This role requires the candidate to explore, learn and master the business domain. The candidate must be motivated and with intellectual curiosity to discover and map out the way our business operates.
Detail oriented. This is a techno-functional role, and candidates must be able to work with both business and system details. The candidate must have keen attention to detail, in order to correctly manage the requirements and technology operations of the system.
Sense of ownership. This is a subject matter expert and systems ownership role. The candidate must be highly self-motivated, and take responsibility for the systems under his/her charge

title: Sr. System Integration Engineer
company: THALES ATM PTY LTD SINGAPORE BRANCH
company_info: THALES ATM PTY LTD SINGAPORE BRANCH
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
KEY ACTIVITIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
As a Senior Systems Integration Engineer, you are accountable for:
Preparing definition documents to align with project targets relating to costs, deadlines and quality, and participating in the product integration and verification phases
Supporting the planning and coordination of program software integration activities, and delivering software integration services for systems and/or sub-systems of products
Defining and leading testing activities (regression, interface, simulation scenarios and test tools)
Product installation, configuration, data management, performance monitoring and systems administration
Leading the integration & block testing of incremental software releases for products and/or projects, in accordance with the schedule
Providing expert technical support and the setup of environments to developers, testers and end users, and providing support to the software integration team, development and validation teams during the implementation phase of the project
Identifying risks and proposing effective solutions
Authoring documentation and documentation updates

RESPONSIBILITIES
The Senior Engineer is a professional engineer performing duties requiring the application of mature professional engineering knowledge. With scope for individual accomplishment and coordination of more difficult assignments, the professional deals with problems for which it is necessary to modify established guides and devise new approaches.

The Senior Engineer may make some original contribution or apply new professional engineering approaches and techniques to the design or development of equipment or special aspects of products, facilities and buildings.

Recommendations may be reviewed for soundness of judgement but are usually regarded as technically accurate and feasible. The Senior Engineer makes responsible decisions on matters assigned, including the establishment of professional engineering standards and procedures, consults, recommends and advises in speciality engineering areas.

Work is carried out within broad guidelines requiring conformity with overall objectives, relative priorities and necessary cooperation with other units. Informed professional engineering guidance may be available.

The Senior Engineer outlines and assigns work, reviews it for technical accuracy and adequacy, and may plan, direct, coordinate and supervise the work of other professional and technical staff.

KEY KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE
To be successful in your role, you will have demonstrated the following knowledge and experience:
A tertiary qualification in Engineering, Computer Science or IT
Solid understanding of software integration and testing processes including regression, interface, simulation scenarios and test tools
Solid experience in using UNIX/Linux operating systems, binary and source level debugging tools, Requirement/Test and Defect Management Systems
Practical experience of integration and verification of software / hardware components on large, complex, software-based systems
Practical experience with programming languages such as; Java, Shell Scripting, Python and continuous integration tools such as Git and Jenkins
Strong communication skills, with the ability to write clear and concise documents that clearly articulate complex technical detail

company_info: RecruitFlash is a Singapore-based recruitment and staffing solution provider. To ensure our service always deliver as per our commitment, our principle is to make sure every candidate that we recommend will be most suitable for our valuable client. We offer jobseekers and employers a wide range of services to meet their unique and specific needs. Our service covers: • Permanent Placement • Talent Searches • Executive Searches

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
• Good Bonus - AWS + 3 month Variable Bonus / Permanent Role
Engineer / Electrical engineer / Project Engineer / Junior & Senior & Engineering can apply
• Entry level / Junior / Senior / No experience welcome apply X 3 Opening
• Full training provided

§ System Administration and Installation of UNIX/LINUX/WINDOWS Servers & Workstations
§ Software Configuration Management using Rational Clear Case and RCS
§ Basic Network Setup (routers, switchers, IP addresses)
§ Database Modeling and Parameterization (Oracle)
§ Scripting using Java Scripts, Perl, ksh, csh, bsh, bash

§ Functional and Integration Testing
§ Site Commissioning of delivered SCADA/'DMS/EMS systems
§ Warranty support and maintenance for delivered projects

§ 5 to 10 years’ experience in SCADA/EMS/DMS systems or Real Time software development in a UNIX/LINUX environment.

Salary for experience candidates will be considered based on the years of experience and our internal salary structure
1 month AWS
Variable Bonus ranging from 1 to 3 months depending on individual and company performance
Working hours: 8.00 am to 5.00 pm / 8.30 to 5.30 pm / 9.00 am to 6.00 pm / 9.30 am to 6.30pm / 10.00am to 7.00pm
Working days: Monday to Friday (1 day work from home per week)
Annual Leave: 14 days up to 17 days for non-executive (Assistant Engineer and below)
18 days up to 21 days for executive (Engineer and above)
Medical benefits of $500 per financial year (Benefit is extended to spouse and children (below 21 years old) of married employees)
Insurance coverage: Hospital & Surgical (Benefit is extended to spouse and children (below 25 years old) of married male employees and child (below 25 years old) of married female employees)
Term Life

Monthly Sports Activities
New Born Gift
CSR Initiatives
Department Bonding Activities

Gym Corner for employees to exercise
Good Pay + Good allowance + Good Bonus

title: System Administrator
